0.title: Queen Elizabeth's state funeral begins at Westminster Abbey
0.article_body: Britain's longest-serving monarch Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral service has begun at Westminster Abbey in London. Prior to the funeral, a tenor bell at the abbey tolled 96 times, once for each year of the Queen's life. Notably, world leaders including President of India Droupadi Murmu, US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron are attending the Queen's funeral.

1.title: Statue of Unity of no use, ₹3,000 cr should’ve been used for tribals: BTP leader
1.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatiya Tribal Party leader Chhotubhai Vasava said the Statue of Unity "has been of no use". On being asked, BJP has cited the Statue of Unity as one of its development projects in tribal areas for employment generation, Vasava said, "They spent ₹3,000 crore on the statue. They should have spent that money on development of tribal areas."

2.title: Gurugram civic body's enforcement team thrashed by multiple people
2.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram's enforcement team was allegedly attacked by unidentified suspects near the city's Mahavir Chowk. One official was thrashed by multiple people while another was hit by a stone, officials said. Notably, the incident happened when the enforcement team had gone to move about 40 illegal street vendors to a newly set up vending zone.

3.title: ‘Beyond The Star’ docu-series on Salman to release on his b'day: Report
3.article_body: 'Beyond The Star', the docu-series on Salman Khan, will reportedly release on December 27, which also happens to be the actor's birthday. As per reports, 'Beyond The Star' will see Salman's family, friends, co-stars and directors sharing their opinions on the actor. The docu-series, which is co-produced by Salman, will reportedly also show never-seen-before pictures and videos from his childhood.

4.title: Parts of B'luru to face power cuts on Sept 21 & 23 from 10 am-5 pm
4.article_body: Some parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts on September 21 and 23 between 10:00 am and 5:00 pm due to repair and maintenance work being undertaken by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). Areas like Veerabhadra Nagar, Hanumantha Nagar and Pramod Layout will be affected on September 21. Bairohalli, Ramohalli and Kengeri Town will be affected on September 23.

5.title: Cheetahs brought from Namibia 'cheerful' after first meal in India: Officials
5.article_body: The eight cheetahs brought to India from Nambia on Saturday had their first meal in India at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on Sunday evening and appeared cheerful and in good spirits, according to the park's officials. Each of the eight cheetahs was served two kilograms of buffalo meat. One of them ate less, but it's not concerning, officials added.

6.title: Eager to get house after dad's death, Delhi man kills brother with scissors
6.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing his 21-year-old brother to death with a pair of scissors over property dispute in Delhi. The accused was upset after his father, who died of COVID-19, left his house in his wife's name. "He [accused] fought with his family...as he wanted it [house] to be registered under his name," police said.

7.title: Will use some of them: Ayan on fan theories around 'Brahmastra' trilogy
7.article_body: Celebrating Brahmastra's box office success, director Ayan Mukerji shared that the makers are "absorbing and learning" from audiences' feedback. He appreciated "amazing fan theories" around the upcoming films in the 'Brahmastra' trilogy and said he's "definitely going to use" some of them. Ayan also shared that he has started work on 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev & The Astraverse'.

8.title: Dhanush shares his look from 'Captain Miller', fans react
8.article_body: Dhanush took to Instagram to share a post revealing his look from the upcoming Tamil film 'Captain Miller'. Several fans reacted to his look with comments like "super", "can't wait" and "killing it". Arun Matheswaran, the filmmaker who is helming the film, also shared Dhanush's look on his Instagram Stories with the caption, "Killer Killer, Captain Miller!!"

9.title: Mumbai youth booked under Arms Act for cutting b'day cakes with sword
9.article_body: Police have booked a 17-year-old youth under Arms Act for cutting birthday cakes with a sword in Mumbai. A video of the act has gone viral on social media, showing the youth cutting at least 21 cakes with a sword in his hand, while his friends cheer for him during the party. Police said the video is from Borivali area.

10.title: Told bank I don't need loan anymore: Auto driver who won ₹25 cr lottery
10.article_body: An autorickshaw driver in Kerala, who won ₹25 crore lottery just a day after his application for ₹3 lakh loan (to go to Malaysia to work as a chef) was approved, said that he had told the bank that he doesn’t need the loan anymore. Lottery winner Anoop said that he will start something in the hotel field in Kerala.

11.title: ED attaches ₹48-cr assets belonging to ex-Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, his aide
11.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday attached assets worth ₹48 crore "beneficially owned" by former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection with the teacher recruitment scam. The attached properties include flats, a farmhouse and prime land in Kolkata. With this, the total attachment in the case stands at ₹103.10 crore.

12.title: Man burnt alive after truck catches fire in J&K's Kathua
12.article_body: A man burnt to death after the truck he was travelling in caught fire on Jammu-Pathankot national highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The victim was the truck driver's helper and his identity is yet to be ascertained, police said. A fire tender reached the spot and controlled the fire, but it was too late to save the man.

13.title: Actress Kate Winslet rushed to hospital after slipping on her film set
13.article_body: Hollywood actress Kate Winslet was rushed to a hospital in Croatia after she slipped on the set of her film 'Lee', her representative said. "Kate...was taken to hospital as a precautionary measure required by the production. She is fine and will be filming, as planned, this week," the representative stated. The film is a biopic of Lee Miller, the model-turned-photographer.

14.title: 2 couples killed in accident after attending condolence meet in Rajasthan
14.article_body: Two couples travelling on a motorcycle and a scooty in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district were killed on Sunday when a car rammed into the vehicles from behind and overturned. The car driver left his vehicle behind and fled the spot. The deceased were travelling to Narnaul in Haryana after attending a condolence meeting near Singhana, police said.

15.title: Fake accounting: Mohandas Pai as OYO claims first EBITDA positive quarter
15.article_body: TV Mohandas Pai, the former CFO of Infosys, accused OYO of "fake accounting" after the startup claimed it turned EBITDA positive for the first time in the first quarter of FY23, with an adjusted EBITDA of ₹7.3 crore. "There is nothing like...adjusted EBITDA. They are trying to mislead investors...Regulators and stock exchanges should stop such misreporting in India," Pai tweeted.

16.title: Haven’t planned but definitely look forward to being a mother: Gauahar
16.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan said she is looking forward to being a mother. "I definitely look forward to being a mother. I really hope that happens soon," she said, adding that she hasn't planned for it because she believes it will happen when it's ought to happen. She added she hasn't even had any such conversation with her husband Zaid Darbar.

17.title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra plays football wearing saree, shares pics
17.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra on Monday shared pictures of her playing football in a saree at the Krishnanagar MP Cup Tournament 2022. In the pictures, Moitra can be seen wearing sports shoes and a pair of sunglasses. She wrote alongside, "Fun moments from the final of the Krishnanagar MP Cup Tournament 2022. And yes, I play in a saree."

18.title: Some iPhone 14 Pro users face camera shaking, rattling on using Instagram, TikTok
18.article_body: Some users are reportedly facing an issue with iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max cameras. Users took to social media to share visuals of the camera shaking and making a rattling noise when using a third-party app like Instagram, Snapchat or TikTok. As per a report, this may be an issue with the third-party app software rather than Apple's hardware.

19.title: Made to feel like a living, elastic bubble: Apple iPhone's 'dynamic island' designer
19.article_body: Chan Karunamuni, the Human Interface Designer at Apple who designed the latest iPhone's 'dynamic island', tweeted, "Its goal is to feel like a living, elastic bubble that can fluidly shapeshift into different alerts and experiences." 'Dynamic Island' is a pill-shaped cutout at the top of iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max. It can display an array of notifications.

20.title: It blew us away: James Cameron on remastered version of 'Avatar'
20.article_body: Director James Cameron said his 2009 film 'Avatar', which is re-releasing at theatres, is looking "better than it ever looked". "We just watched the film recently when we finished the whole remastering process, and it kinda blew us away," he said about the film, which has been remastered in 4K. 'Avatar' is scheduled to re-release on September 23.

21.title: Bangladeshi clerics violate visa norms: Assam govt writes to Centre
21.article_body: Assam government has written to Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) about Bangladeshi clerics violating the norms of their tourist visas by indulging in religious activities. This comes a day after 17 Bangladesh nationals were arrested from Biswanath district for indulging in religious activities. DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said many Bangladeshi clerics have been barred from entering Assam.

22.title: Hyd student invests education loan money into share market; missing
22.article_body: An engineering student in Hyderabad went missing after investing educational loan amount into share market. The student had taken ₹1 lakh from his parents and ₹1.10 lakh education loan from SBI to pay fees. When the boy's parents asked him the reason behind not paying fees, the boy said he had lent it to a friend and later went missing.

23.title: 24-year-old engineering student drowns in private pool in Hyderabad
23.article_body: A 24-year-old engineering student drowned in a private swimming pool in Hyderabad on Sunday, police said. Following the incident, the deceased's family claimed that there was negligence by the pool's management and demanded that action should be taken against them. The deceased had been out with his friends to play cricket and then had gone to the pool, officers added.

24.title: Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Doctor G' to release on October 14
24.article_body:
Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Monday announced the release date of his upcoming film, 
'Doctor G'. Sharing a couple of posters on his Instagram account, Ayushmann wrote that his film, which also stars Rakul Preet Singh, will release on October 14. Earlier in a statement, Ayushmann said, "It's an honour to portray a doctor on the screen for the first time."

25.title: Bitcoin falls below $19,000 to 3-month low
25.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell about 5% to a three-month low of $18,387 on Monday. Ether dropped 3% to a two-month low of $1,285 and is down more than 10% in the last 24 hours. Dogecoin, which currently stands as the world's 10th largest cryptocurrency, has fallen 8.11% in the last 24 hours, CoinMarketCap data showed.

26.title: Truth & justice will win: AAP MP on Chandigarh University issue
26.article_body: Speaking about the Chandigarh University video leak incident, AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Monday said that truth and justice will win. "Our senior police officials are present at the spot. Strict actions will be taken against the accused," Chadha added. "This is a serious and sensitive issue. The Punjab government is standing with the students," he stated.

27.title: Instagram rewards Jaipur student with ₹38 lakh for finding a bug
27.article_body: Neeraj Sharma, a student from Rajasthan's Jaipur, has been rewarded ₹38 lakh by Instagram for reporting a bug. "There was a bug in Facebook's Instagram, through which the thumbnail of the reel could have been changed from any account," reports quoted Sharma as saying. He shared a demo of the bug with Facebook and his report was approved.

28.title: Parineeti announces her next film 'Tiranga', to release on Oct 14
28.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra on Monday announced her upcoming Ribhu Dasgupta directorial, titled 'Code Name: Tiranga'. The espionage action thriller, which will release on October 14, will see Parineeti play a RAW agent. "I hope the audiences enjoy this action entertainer which talks about a soldier's sacrifice in the line of duty for her nation," the director said in a statement.

29.title: Russia attacked Pivdennoukrainsk nuclear plant, reactors not damaged: Ukraine
29.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear company Energoatom said Russian troops struck the Pivdennoukrainsk nuclear power plant in Mykolaiv region on Monday. The blast that took place 300 metres away from the reactors, damaged a nearby hydroelectric power plant and transmission lines but all three power units remained functional. Ukraine's Mykolaiv region has been facing rocket attacks by Russian forces in recent weeks.

30.title: 29-year-old actress Deepa found dead at her Chennai apartment, letter recovered
30.article_body: Actress Deepa, also known as Pauline Jessica, was found dead in her apartment in Chennai, following which police filed a case and recovered a letter from her home. A police official said that the 29-year-old's family members had sent her friend Prabhakaran to check on her after she didn't respond to their calls. Prabhakaran found her dead and alerted them.

31.title: Ola fires 200 engineers to 'minimise redundancy'
31.article_body: Ola has confirmed that it is laying off some employees after a report claimed that the company was planning to fire at least 500 employees across software teams. Ola, however, said only about 200 engineers, including some in the software vertical, have been asked to go. Ola said it is "centralising operations and undertaking a restructuring exercise to minimise redundancy".

32.title: Amarinder Singh meets JP Nadda ahead of joining BJP
32.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh met BJP National President JP Nadda in the national capital ahead of joining the party. “Amarinder Singh is also likely to merge his PLC party with the BJP,” PLC spokesperson Pritpal Singh said. Former CM made the announcement of joining the BJP after he met the Union Home Minister Amit Shah on September 12.

33.title: Rahul Gandhi speaks to Kerala fishermen during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
33.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi interacted with fishermen about their plights at Vadackal beach in Kerala's Alappuzha during the party's "Bharat Jodo Yatra." He discussed a variety of topics, including the rising cost of fuel, decreasing subsidies, dwindling fish stocks, and inadequate opportunities. The yatra is in its Kerala leg and will reach Karnataka on September 30.

34.title: Jitendra Singh to take part in Global Clean Energy Action Forum
34.article_body: Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh will lead an Indian delegation at the Global Clean Energy Action Forum this week in the US. Ministers from over 30 countries will participate in the event to discuss ways of accelerating clean energy innovation and deployment. He is likely to talk about India's commitment to a low-carbon future.

35.title: OYO's FY22 revenue rises to ₹4,905 cr, loss narrows to ₹1,851 cr
35.article_body: Travel-tech company OYO filed financial documents with SEBI stating that its revenue rose 18% to ₹4,905 crore in FY22 from the previous year, while net loss narrowed 45% to ₹1,851 crore. OYO clocked EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation) profit of ₹10.6 crore for June quarter. The company is behind pre-COVID annual revenue of ₹13,413 crore in FY20.

36.title: Chandigarh University is based in Punjab: Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher on 'video leak' case
36.article_body: Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher has said she is "morally shaken by the ghastly incident" at Chandigarh University. She tweeted, "The name of my city is being tarnished...I want to clarify that it is based in Kharar, Punjab." It comes after alleged leak of videos of girls taking baths, however, police said they found a video of the accused girl herself.

37.title: 28-year-old Indian student dies after being shot in Canada
37.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian student, Satwinder Singh, has succumbed to the injuries sustained during a shooting in Canada's Ontario last week that also claimed two other lives, police said. The gunman identified as 40-year-old Sean Petrie was shot dead by police. A fundraiser was started to support his parents and send his body back to India.

38.title: US broke promises on nuclear deal, we need guarantee: Iranian President
38.article_body: Tehran would be serious about reviving the nuclear deal if the US guarantees not to withdraw from it, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi told CBS. Raisi said that Iran would be serious about the deal if it is fair but Americans could not be trusted. Tehran wants the UN nuclear watchdog to close probe into uranium traces found at undeclared sites.

39.title: Samajwadi Party's march against BJP stopped, police say 'No permission taken'
39.article_body: Samajwadi Party's march against Bharatiya Janata Party was stopped midway in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said the march was stopped because "the government was afraid of answering questions". Police said the protestors had not taken any permission. "They were assigned designated route which wouldn't have caused traffic congestion. They refused to take that," police added.

40.title: FedEx to close 90 office locations, pause hiring amid decline in global demand
40.article_body: FedEx has said it would be closing 90 office locations, five corporate offices and delaying new hiring amid a decline in its global package delivery business. FedEx Ground's revenue fell about $300 million below company forecasts. This segment handles e-commerce deliveries in the US. On Friday, FedEx shares plunged 21.2%, marking its biggest one-day drop in more than 40 years.

41.title: 3 of family dead after roof collapses in UP's Deoria amid heavy rains
41.article_body: Three members of a family were killed after the roof of a two-storey building collapsed and trapped them in early hours of Monday in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria. The building was reportedly vulnerable and decayed. UP has witnessed several casualties due to wall collapse over incessant rainfall. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath had announced ₹4 lakh compensation for the families of deceased.

42.title: Makers need to understand that it's getting predictable: Tisca on B'wood
42.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said many Bollywood films are failing to perform at the box office because they are "getting predictable and repetitive". She said the makers "constantly look at things from a commercial point of view", which needs to change. She added if the makers put "more energy and emphasis" on writing, Bollywood will have "far better and fresher content".

43.title: BMC to set up its first pet cremation incinerator in Malad in 2 months
43.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is setting up a pet incinerator at cow and dog pound in Evershine Nagar, Malad, which will be operational in about two months. The price for pet cremation is yet to be decided, however, stray animals can be cremated free of cost, said reports. It will be an odourless and pollution-free process, said the official.

44.title: Body of electrician found 2 days after being swept away in Maha creek
44.article_body: The body of an electrician, who was swept away in the strong water current of Kamba Creek near Maharashtra's Bhiwandi amid heavy rainfall, was recovered on Sunday evening. The deceased and his colleague had gone to the spot to fix an electrical issue on Friday. His video of holding himself on high-tension wires trying to save himself had gone viral.

45.title: Charity rescues 372 people trying to cross Mediterranean; 1 dead
45.article_body: A Spanish charity, Open Arms, has recovered the body of one man and rescued 372 people on board unseaworthy smugglers' boats who were trying to cross the central Mediterranean to enter Europe, officials said on Sunday. The deceased was shot dead by smugglers. "The smugglers forced the people to take the corpse with them," a spokesperson of the charity said.

46.title: He's one of the most nuanced actors I've witnessed: R Balki on Dulquer
46.article_body: Director R Balki said he's been observing Dulquer Salmaan's filmography and finds his taste in films "outstanding". He called Dulquer "one of the most nuanced actors" in Indian cinema, and said he's glad the actor liked the script of 'Chup' and agreed to do the film. "I thought a role like this needed someone like him," he added.

47.title: Thousands camp to get best spots to view Queen's funeral; pics surface
47.article_body: Pictures of thousands of people camping overnight in London to get the best spots to view the funeral procession of Queen Elizabeth II have surfaced online. "This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be part of history," a 60-year-old woman who camped in a tent with her two daughters and grandchildren said. Some people were also seen sleeping on the ground.

48.title: Pak will absolutely not default on debts despite floods: Minister
48.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Miftah Ismail told Reuters on Sunday that the country will "absolutely not" default on its debt obligations despite the floods which have affected 33 million citizens. He added that while the path to stability "has become narrower", the country won't default if it continues to take "prudent decisions". Most stabilisation policies are on track, he further said.

49.title: All-women special investigation team to probe Chandigarh University 'videos leak' case
49.article_body: A three-member all-women special investigation team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the Chandigarh University 'videos leak' case, Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said on Monday. The SIT will probe the case under the supervision of senior IPS officer Gurpreet Kaur Deo. "The SIT will go to the bottom of the conspiracy," DGP Yadav said.

50.title: I surrender in films I commit to: Ayesha on Akshay spitting water in Khiladi
50.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka opened up about a scene in the 1992 film 'Khiladi' in which Akshay Kumar could be seen spitting water on Ayesha's face. "Once I decide to do a project, with all the clarity, then I would go all out, surrender myself," she stated. Ayesha added, "You must say establish don'ts...before you sign the project, which I have."

51.title: Milk production down by 8 lakh litre/day in Rajasthan due to lumpy skin disease
51.article_body: The lumpy skin disease has affected milk production in Rajasthan as the state witnessed a decline of over 21% in milk production during August. As per the Rajasthan Cooperative Dairy Federation (RCDF), milk collection is estimated to have reduced by 6 to 8 lakh litres per day. In some places of western Rajasthan, milk production has come down to zero.

52.title: Unseen photo of smiling Queen Elizabeth II released ahead of her funeral today
52.article_body: A previously unseen photo of smiling Queen Elizabeth II has been released by Buckingham Palace ahead of her funeral. The portrait was taken by photographer Ranald Mackechnie in Windsor Castle in May, ahead of her Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Britain's longest-serving monarch, Queen Elizabeth II, will be honoured with a full state funeral at Westminster Abbey today.

53.title: We can't have new hires not seeing a TCS office: COO Subramaniam
53.article_body: N Ganapathy Subramaniam, the COO of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), said the company "can't have new joinees not seeing a TCS office or interacting with role models as mentors". He said that remote working as the only goal will lead to "a very transactional experience". Notably, only less than 20% of TCS' workforce has reportedly returned to work from office.

54.title: Would have stopped the film if Diljit hadn’t done it: 'Jogi' director
54.article_body: 'Jogi' director Ali Abbas Zafar said he wouldn't have worked on the film if Diljit Dosanjh hadn't agreed to do it. "He is so subtle; only his eyes speak in the film. That's what I wanted in the character - someone understated who rises to the occasion," he said. Ali added, "No one could have done it, apart from Diljit."

55.title: Delhi court stays proceedings against Satyendar Jain, ED seeks trial transfer
55.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday stayed the proceedings in a money laundering case against AAP leader Satyendar Jain. This comes after an application filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seeking the transfer of the entire proceedings from a special court. ED had arrested Jain in connection with a case based on a CBI FIR lodged against him in 2017.

56.title: Ranbir says he, Alia, Ayan went to SRK's home to approach him for Brahmastra
56.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent interview, said that he, actress Alia Bhatt and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji went to actor Shah Rukh Khan's house when they had to approach him for 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir said that Khan, without thinking for a second, said that he is on board and will do whatever they would want him to do.

57.title: Remo inspired choreographers to become directors: Bosco Martis
57.article_body: Choreographer Bosco Martis, who is making his directorial debut with 'Rocket Gang', said Remo D'souza inspired choreographers to explore direction. "He is one of the choreographers who has started this journey of transforming from a choreographer to a director and definitely inspired many of us," he said. 'Rocket Gang' stars Aditya Seal and Nikita Dutta in the lead roles.

58.title: 72-year-old Mumbai woman practising law with fake licence for decades arrested
58.article_body: A 72-year-old woman in Mumbai was arrested on Saturday for impersonating a lawyer and practising in a family court without proper authorisation for decades. The woman identified as Mordekai Rebecca Joub alias Mandakini Kashinath Sohini had allegedly been practising in various courts based on a fake lawyer's licence. She has been remanded in BKC police custody.

59.title: Following law & order is too much expectation from SP: UP CM on SP's march
59.article_body: Following law and order is too much of an expectation from Samajwadi Party leaders, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Monday, following SP’s march against the state government. "There is no harm if any party asks their questions in a democratic way. Samajwadi Party should take permission for any procession which should not harm anyone," CM Yogi added.

60.title: Astronaut shares pic of Earth at night from space, asks 'how many nations can you spot'
60.article_body: Italian astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti recently shared a picture of Earth at night from the International Space Station. "From the Atlantic looking East towards the sunrise...how many countries and European cities can you spot? I can see my birthplace," she wrote with the picture. She later shared pictures identifying Germany, Spain, UK, Ireland, Greece and Italy among others.

61.title: SP is jobless, they have nothing to do: UP Dy CM on SP's march
61.article_body: Following Samajwadi Party’s march against UP government, Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Monday said it's not related to the benefit of common people. "If they want to discuss this, they're free to do it in the Assembly," Maurya added. Furthermore, he said, "SP is jobless now, they have nothing to do. Such protests will only create problems for people."

62.title: Teenagers steal 4 autos in Mumbai, make Insta reels in it; detained
62.article_body: A 19-year-old mechanic was arrested and a 14-year-old boy was detained by Mumbai Police for allegedly stealing four auto-rickshaws worth ₹3,60,000. The duo was identified from their Instagram reels shot while driving the stolen vehicles. As per police, the main accused Armaan Ansari wanted to own autos and started stealing them from roadside while the minor accompanied him for fun.

63.title: Jet Airways relaunch faces delay amid talks with lenders & engine makers: Report
63.article_body: Jet Airways, under its new owner the Jalan-Kalrock consortium, is reportedly facing a delay in its relaunch that is scheduled for this month. According to people aware of the matter, there are unresolved negotiations between the management and engine makers and the airline's former lenders are seeking settlement of dues before the airline buys or leases aircraft.

64.title: It only had menu about our practice: Ashish Nehra on viral pic with paper in IPL 2022
64.article_body: GT head coach Ashish Nehra opened up about his viral picture with paper during IPL 2022. "The paper had nothing. Don't know why people think [it had something important]." He added, "It just had the menu about our practice session." With GT's IPL 2022 win, Nehra became the first Indian to win IPL title as head coach.

65.title: 90 GTA 6 gameplay videos posted online as Rockstar Games suffers massive leak
65.article_body: Rockstar Games suffered a massive leak with around 90 development videos of its much-awaited Grand Theft Auto (GTA) 6 being posted online by the alleged hacker on GTAForums. Various clips from the video game have depicted male and female playable characters. The videos also show the gameplay in a Miami-like fictional city, in line with earlier reports about the game.

66.title: Sidharth Malhotra meets fans at India Gate amid 'Yodha' shoot
66.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who is currently in Delhi shooting for 'Yodha', met and interacted with his fans at India Gate on Sunday. The actor can be seen shaking everyone's hands and posing for selfies in a video shared by a media account. 'Yodha' is scheduled to be released on November 11 and features Disha Patani and Raashii Khanna.

67.title: Akhilesh, SP leaders take out march to state Assembly against UP govt
67.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, other party leaders and workers on Monday organised a march to the state Assembly, from their party office in Lucknow, against UP government. The Monsoon Session of state legislature will commence today. During the march, party MLAs and MLCs will raise issues of unemployment, price rise, crime against women, etc, SP's Rajendra Chaudhary said yesterday.

68.title: Telangana CM KCR names 9-year-old girl who grew up without name
68.article_body: A nine-year-old girl who grew up without a name as her parents wanted Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to give her one was finally named 'Mahati' by Rao on Sunday. The couple, who are from Jayashankar Bhupalpally district, were active members of the Telangana statehood movement. State CMO tweeted that the family was received by Rao and his wife.

69.title: US forces will defend Taiwan against Chinese invasion: US President Biden
69.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said US forces would defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion. Asked to clarify if he meant that unlike in Ukraine, US forces would defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion, Biden replied, "Yes." Taiwan expressed "sincere gratitude" to Biden for "affirming the US government's rock-solid promise of security to Taiwan".

70.title: Bihar govt to introduce 'no-bag day', mandatory games period in schools
70.article_body: The Bihar government will be introducing a "no-bag day" rule in schools and a mandatory games period at least once a week to reduce burden on students, an official said on Sunday. "At least once a week, students will come to schools only with their lunch boxes. The day will be devoted to practical and experiential learning," the official added.

71.title: Hurricane Fiona makes landfall in Puerto Rico, leaving island without power
71.article_body: Hurricane Fiona made landfall along Puerto Rico's southwest coast on Sunday, triggering landslides and knocking out power. The storm ripped asphalt from roads, swept away a major bridge, closed airports and led to 'historic' levels of rain. Fiona made landfall with maximum sustained winds of about 140 kilometres per hour, clearing threshold for Category 1 hurricane, National Hurricane Center said.

72.title: Lady Gaga posts pic of her crying as lightning strikes cancel concert in Miami
72.article_body: American singer-songwriter Lady Gaga was recently forced to cut her Miami concert short, due to a tropical thunderstorm. The singer said that lightning strikes were hitting too close to the stadium. Sharing a picture of her crying, Gaga wrote, "I'm sorry I couldn't finish the show it was too dangerous the lightening was being unpredictable and changing moment by moment."

73.title: Was insensitive and depressing, I couldn't take it: Balki on 'Cheeni...' review
73.article_body: While talking about a review that he got for his film 'Cheeni Kum', filmmaker R Balki said that "it was very depressing". "It was the most insensitive review of that time...People were consoling me, but I couldn't take it because it was written about me. So, from then, I decided to stay away from these critics altogether," he added.

74.title: Shinde camp gets nod for Dussehra rally at BKC, Uddhav's application rejected
74.article_body: The MMRDA gave permission to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena faction to hold the Dussehra rally at the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) ground in Mumbai. Meanwhile, the MMRDA rejected Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena's application for another plot in BKC to hold Dussehra rally, saying the plot has already been booked for another event.

75.title: KTR asks MP to adopt temple with stepwell in Ranga Reddy, MP agrees
75.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday wished Chevella MP Ranjith Reddy on his birthday and asked him to adopt the Balaji temple with stepwell near Shamshabad in Ranga Reddy. Ranjith replied to Rao, saying, "Would love to take up this wonderful initiative and revive...heritage of Telangana." This comes after a person tweeted that the "700-year-old" temple wasn't being maintained.

76.title: BJP launches 15-day 'Praja Poru Yatra' in Andhra Pradesh
76.article_body: The BJP launched a 15-day "Praja Poru Yatra" from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam against the YSRCP government. The Poru Yatra will cover 5,000 street corner meetings in 175 Assembly constituencies of the state in the next 15 days. "The YSRCP government has completely failed to rule in Andhra Pradesh. Real problems of people are neglected," said BJP MP GVL Narasimha Rao.

77.title: Kartik Aaryan returns to airport gate to meet young fan, video viral
77.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing actor Kartik Aaryan returning to the gate of Jodhpur airport to meet a fan who was screaming his name. The actor can be seen speaking to the security personnel and asking the fan and her guardian to click pictures from outside the gate. The fans were later allowed to meet Kartik.

78.title: Goa CM and Congress turncoat MLAs to meet PM Modi in Delhi
78.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant and eight MLAs who ditched the Congress to join the BJP will be meeting PM Narendra Modi in Delhi today. The Congress turncoats are also likely to meet BJP President JP Nadda and Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "All the MLAs have joined us because they believe in the vision of PM Modi," said Sawant.

79.title: Govt awards 60 startups, gives ₹10,000 each to 53,021 students
79.article_body: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh presented INSPIRE Awards to 60 startups for innovation and ₹10,000 each to 53,021 students to help develop prototypes of ideas submitted, the Ministry of Science and Technology said. More than 6 lakh people from across the country participated in the annual INSPIRE Awards - MANAK (Million Minds Augmenting National Aspiration and Knowledge), the minister said.

80.title: Supreme Court seeks govt report on retired judges’ posting as ad hoc
80.article_body: Supreme Court has sought a report from central government about the appointment of retired High Court judges. It observed that the "judiciary's promise of speedy justice" has taken a hit due to paucity of judges. The apex court had activated the provision for the appointment of retired judges as ad hoc judges to clear pending cases in March 2021.

81.title: Myanmar refugees in Mizoram instructed not to buy land without govt permission
81.article_body: Mizoram government has issued an order instructing Myanmar refugees seeking shelter in the state not to purchase land or run businesses without the knowledge and prior permission from the state government. The refugees should inform about the vehicles they brought from their country to the concerned local or village level committee on Myanmar refugees, the order stated.

82.title: What is the inspiration behind design of Team India's new jersey?
82.article_body: Team India's new T20I jersey called 'One Blue Jersey' was launched on Sunday. The jersey features a lighter shade of blue and its design comprises triangles and petals. Triangles represent a perfect blend of fans' energy, spirit and power, MPL Sports, the official Team India kit sponsor said. Petals are inspired from BCCI logo, denoting merit and loyalty, it added.

83.title: 1 dead, 4 injured as state transport bus collides with truck in Pune
83.article_body: One person died and four were injured after a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) Shivshahi bus collided with a container truck on Sasvad Road on Sunday night. The bus was going from Pandharpur to Pune's Swargate. Both vehicles, which met with the accident, were removed from the spot with cranes.

84.title: Egyptian Pharaoh Rameses II era-burial cave discovered in Israel
84.article_body: A burial cave from the time of Egyptian Pharaoh Rameses II has been discovered in Israel's Palmahim Beach National Park, Israel Antiquities Authority said. The authority added that the cave was found when a mechanical digger penetrated its roof. Calling it a "once-in-a-lifetime discovery", an expert said that the cave floor is laid out with "vessels untouched for 3,300 years".

85.title: Chandigarh University shut till Saturday, hostel warden suspended over video leak case
85.article_body: Chandigarh University has extended its holiday for students till Saturday after massive protests over the alleged leak of videos of girls taking baths in hostel. The hostel warden was also suspended after students mounted pressure for action over the video leak case, reports said. Police said that the accused girl only sent her own video to her boyfriend in Shimla.

86.title: Will lend my car if anybody wants to leave Cong and join BJP, says Kamal Nath
86.article_body: MP Congress chief Kamal Nath on Sunday said the party wouldn't stop anyone from quitting and that he would lend his car if any member wants to go and join BJP. "What are you thinking? Congress will finish? You are saying some people want to join the BJP. Whoever wants to join the BJP can go," Nath added.

87.title: 38 students complain of stomach ache after UP medical camp visit
87.article_body: As many as 38 female students complained of stomach ache and nausea after they visited a medical camp in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi. The students claimed they were given the wrong medicine.  Sub District Magistrate (Sawayajpur Hardoi) Swati Shukla told ANI that six students were shifted to a civil hospital while the rest, who felt "fine" after treatment, were sent back.

88.title: Retired constable arrested for extortion, impersonating senior in Delhi
88.article_body: A retired Delhi Police head constable has been arrested for impersonating a senior officer to extort money. The incident came to light when a man approached police saying he received calls from a man identifying himself as SHO Samaypur Badli and later SHO South Rohini. The accused forged an identity card to extort people but got caught in first attempt.

89.title: Pilot dies as plane crashes & bursts in flames at US air race event; video surfaces
89.article_body: A pilot died when their plane struck the ground and burst into flames during the Reno Air Races in US' Nevada. The race operations at the event were suspended after the incident. "Oh no. Oh no," one commentator can be heard saying during the live stream of the event on YouTube. The identity of the pilot hasn't been revealed.

90.title: Ranbir Kapoor says there's a 'Brahmastra Feedback' group for memes, criticism
90.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that there is a 'Brahmastra Feedback' group. He added that everyone shares feedback, memes and criticism on the group and that everyone makes fun of themselves. He also said that all of them enjoy the process as such discussions only happen when a film becomes part of pop culture.

91.title: Ghaziabad doctor booked for false complaint over threats to gain publicity
91.article_body: A doctor from Ghaziabad has been booked for lodging a false complaint alleging that he received threat calls for supporting Hindu organisations. Police said that he lodged the complaint to gain publicity. The accused had alleged he received WhatsApp calls from US-based number but it was found after investigation that the calls were from his patient based in Malviya Nagar.

92.title: Post Malone falls into a hole while performing on stage, bruises ribs; video surfaces
92.article_body: Rapper Post Malone bruised his ribs after he collapsed on stage in the middle of his performance at a concert in US. The rapper fell into a hole that had opened moments before to lower his guitar into but had not been covered afterwards. Medics rushed to the 27-year-old's aid, who returned after a short break to finish his performance.

93.title: I'm opposite of your description of me: Arjun on Varun saying he brags the most
93.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, while replying to actor Varun Dhawan's comment on his picture on Instagram, said that he is the opposite of the description Varun gave about him on 'Koffee With Karan'. Varun, on being asked about the Bollywood celebrity who "brags the most", had named Arjun. He had also named him when asked about "who flirts the most".

94.title: Won't take more than 10 mins to thrash violent protesters: TMC's Mitra
94.article_body: Reacting to the incidents of violence reported during BJP's rally in West Bengal, TMC leader Madan Mitra said that they can retaliate with double the force than the attackers. "If there is an instruction from the party's higher-ups it won't take more than ten minutes to thrash those who were involved in hooliganism and vandalism," the TMC MLA added.

95.title: India reports 4,858 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate now at 2.76%
95.article_body: India reported 4,858 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,664 fresh COVID-19 cases. Health Ministry data said 4,735 recoveries were recorded across India in last 24 hours. The active cases in India now stand at 48,027. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 2.76%.

96.title: UN condemns 'shameful' year-long ban on girls' education in Afghanistan
96.article_body: The United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) marked one year of closure of secondary schools for girls in the country. In a statement, UNAMA said there was no credible justification for keeping girls out of schools and the Taliban had failed to enable girls to return to classrooms. The Taliban officials said the ban on girls' education was temporary.

97.title: Ola to fire at least 500 employees across software teams: Report
97.article_body: Ola has reportedly started firing employees across software teams. As per a report, at least 500 employees are likely to be fired across different software verticals of ANI technologies amid Ola Electric scooters' declining sales. While over 30 seniors quit in the last two years, Ola laid off around 2,000 employees during the closure of Ola Cars and Ola Dash.

98.title: Viral video shows men celebrating b'day with fireworks on UP road, 2 held
98.article_body: Indirapuram Police have arrested two people after a video showing birthday celebrations on a road in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad went viral. "The video showed a man resorting to fireworks for celebration while others had placed cakes on the bonnet of the car and [were] throwing them at each other," police said. The arrests were made on Sunday.

99.title: QR-based tickets to be introduced in Bengaluru metro
99.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) is going to introduce QR-based tickets, which will allow commuters to buy tickets through the "Namma Metro" mobile application. "Once they enter a station, passengers could place the QR code electronic ticket against a scanner at the AFC gate to gain entry to the platform level," said BMRCL Managing Director.

100.title: 1 app for banking and investing: Jupiter
100.article_body: Banks charge you a penalty for missing your Mutual Fund SIP due to low balance, said Jupiter, a 100% digital banking & investing app. By investing through the Jupiter banking app, users will benefit from No-Penalty SIP that auto-skips to avoid these penalty charges, Jupiter revealed, adding that users would also save on commission fees.

101.title: Many aspirants for PM post but only 1 who is happy to be 'Pradhan Sevak': Irani
101.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday said PM Narendra Modi’s political rivals "desperately" want power in 2024. "They do not realise that there are many aspirants for post of Pradhan Mantri but only one who is happy to remain 'Pradhan Sevak'....[He] functions in corridors of service...he'll return in 2024 with full blessings of public," she said in Patna.

102.title: Start respecting local languages: KTR to IndiGo as woman 'forced' to change seat
102.article_body: After a Twitter user alleged that a woman onboard an IndiGo flight from Vijayawada to Hyderabad was "forced" to change her exit row seat "because she understood Telugu, not English or Hindi", Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao asked IndiGo to start respecting local languages. He tweeted, "In regional routes, recruit more staff who can speak the local language."

103.title: BEST bus daily ridership rises 9% more than pre-Covid level
103.article_body: The daily ridership in Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) buses has increased by two lakh commuters, from 33 lakh to 35 lakh, in the last two months. At present, the increase in ridership is 9% more than the pre-COVID level of 32 lakh daily passengers in BEST buses. Queues are now longer at some bus stops, an official said.

104.title: eBay removes listings of Queen's coffin viewing wristbands selling for up to £70,000
104.article_body: eBay has removed dozens of listings for wristbands for the queue to see Queen Elizabeth's coffin at Westminster Hall. Sellers were offering the paper bands, which mark mourners' place in the queue as memorabilia. Notably, some used wristbands fetched bids of up to £70,000 before removal. An eBay spokesperson said, "These items are against our policies and we're removing them."

105.title: WB Governor pushes Sunil Chhetri for blocking view for pic at Durand Cup; video viral
105.article_body: A video showing West Bengal Governor La Ganesan pushing winning team Bengaluru FC's captain Sunil Chhetri for blocking his view for a photo after the Durand Cup final is going viral on social media. The incident happened during the trophy-presentation ceremony. Several people criticised the Governor on social media, with a Twitter user saying, "Respect the Player."

106.title: Indian knowledge systems have become more relevant than ever: Union Minister
106.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Sunday said Indian knowledge systems today have become more relevant than ever, especially in providing solutions to current global challenges. Speaking at a convocation event in Thanjavur, Pradhan said, "We've inherited great civilisational legacy from our greats like Charaka, Sushruta...Thiruvalluvar that led our education system to solve global challenges."

107.title: Married couple kills self after dispute over milk in Gurugram
107.article_body: A married couple allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram following a dispute over milk, police said on Sunday. Reportedly, the husband was declared dead at a hospital after he consumed poison and when the wife received the news, she also died by suicide, police added. "The bodies have been sent for autopsy and further investigation is underway," an SHO said.

108.title: 21-year-old arrested for making hoax bomb call to Mumbai Police
108.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) arrested a 21-year-old for allegedly making a hoax call to the police control room in June this year. He had claimed that terrorists were present at the Dadar and Parel railway stations. The accused has been identified as Rahul Shripati Ravidas, who hails from the Giridih district in Jharkhand.

109.title: Dog bites Pune policeman as man sets it off at him to escape arrest
109.article_body: A man set off his dog at a policeman to escape arrest in Pune. Police had gone to arrest 24-year-old Ravindra Ghadge, following a tip-off about marijuana sale. Another man, Sagar Ghadge, who was also present at the site, set off his dog at the police. Constable Sandip Patil suffered a dog bite. Police were able to arrest Ravindra Ghadge.

110.title: Chandigarh University students end protest as police assure fair probe in videos case
110.article_body: Students of Chandigarh University ended their protest and vacated protest site by 3:30 am on Monday after police, district administration and university administration assured a fair probe in leaked videos case. The protests had erupted after allegations that a hosteller leaked objectionable videos of fellow students. Police have arrested two people and detained one in connection with the case.

111.title: Over 2,000 kg of banned plastics seized in Mumbai, ₹16 lakh fine collected
111.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) seized more than 2,000 kg of banned single-use plastics in last two-and-half months and collected a fine of ₹16 lakh from shops and dealers using banned plastics. The drive against banned single-use plastics was revived by the Mumbai civic body starting July 1. BMC took action against 318 violators till September 14, an official said.

112.title: President Murmu meets King Charles at Buckingham Palace ahead of Queen's funeral
112.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu met King Charles III at a reception held at Buckingham Palace on Sunday ahead of Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral on Monday. Earlier, the President had visited Westminster Hall in London, where the Queen's body is lying in state. She also signed the condolence book for Queen Elizabeth at the Lancaster House in London.

113.title: Hyd traffic police officer assaulted while on duty; case filed
113.article_body: A case was registered after a traffic police officer was allegedly assaulted when he tried to take a picture of a two-wheeler whose driver and pillion rider weren't wearing helmets in Hyderabad's Panjagutta. According to the complaint, the pillion rider apparently twisted the officer's hand, abused him and threatened him. The pillion rider is a rowdy sheeter, the officer claimed.

114.title: 62,190 people fined in Delhi for not wearing seat belts in 2021: Report
114.article_body: Traffic police fined 62,190 people in Delhi for not wearing seat belts in 2021, Delhi Road Crash Report said. The report said that it is a 35% rise from 45,907 people penalised for the offence in 2020. Meanwhile, the fines for not wearing seat belts have seen a decline over the years, the report further said.

115.title: Shimla man, who called accused girl in Chandigarh University video case, detained
115.article_body: After the arrest of the accused girl student and her 23-year-old boyfriend Sunny Mehta from Shimla in the Chandigarh University video case, Punjab Police have detained another 31-year-old man named Rankaj Verma. Verma had called the accused student while she was being questioned by the warden, The Indian Express reported. His phone number was mentioned in the FIR, it added.

116.title: Divya Bharti, I were neighbours, she used to say 'I'm in love with you': Ayesha
116.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka said that she and late actress Divya Bharti were very fond of each other. She also revealed that the two used to be neighbours and that Divya often told Ayesha that she was in love with her. She also recalled playing Divya's sister in 'Rang' and said they were very close to each other.

117.title: Billionaire businessman Chip Wilson donates $76 mn to preserve Canada's forest land
117.article_body: Billionaire businessman and Founder of Lululemon Athletica, Chip Wilson, has decided to donate C$100 million ($75.8 million) to preserve wilderness in Canada. The donation will be used to purchase forests in British Columbia along with mining, forestry and other resource licenses to turn the lands into parks that indigenous groups can manage and profit from through tourism.

118.title: COVID-19 pandemic is over in US: President Biden
118.article_body: Speaking about COVID-19 pandemic, US President Joe Biden said, "The pandemic is over. We (the US) still have a problem with COVID. We're still doing a lot of work on it. But the pandemic is over." Meanwhile, the US government still designates COVID-19 a Public Health Emergency and the WHO says it remains a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

119.title: SpaceX launches 54 Starlink satellites after 5 delays in its 180th launch
119.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched 54 Starlink satellites after five consecutive delays, completing its 180th launch to date. The flight also marked SpaceX's 42nd launch of 2022. The first launch for the latest mission was attempted on September 13, however, it saw multiple delays due to unfavorable weather. The Starlink satellite internet service is now available on all seven continents.

120.title: I take names a lot, it came in film: Ayan on 'Shiva' dialogue in 'Brahmastra'
120.article_body: While talking about actress Alia Bhatt's repeated 'Shiva' dialogue in 'Brahmastra', filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that while talking, he takes names a lot. "So that stayed in the script and came in the film as well," he added. Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that he and Alia would ask Ayan if they have to keep repeating their names in the film.

121.title: Ludacris' manager Zulu charged with murder in June shooting in US that left him injured
121.article_body: Music entrepreneur Chaka Zulu, longtime manager of rapper Ludacris, has been charged with murder in a June shooting in which he was injured. The 52-year-old turned himself in at the Fulton County Jail on Tuesday, the Atlanta Police Department said. His lawyer stated that Zulu had been attacked by four people and he discharged his weapon in self-defence.

122.title: Arsenal's Ethan Nwaneri becomes Premier League's youngest-ever player at 15
122.article_body: Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri on Sunday created history by becoming the youngest-ever player to feature in a Premier League match. He came on as substitute during Arsenal's 3-0 victory against Brentford. Aged 15 years, 5 months and 23 days, Nwaneri broke the record previously held by Liverpool's Harvey Elliott (16 years, 30 days). Elliott set the then record in 2019.

123.title: IAF's Suryakiran Aerobatic Team conducts air show in Odisha's Puri
123.article_body: The Suryakiran Aerobatic Team of the Indian Air Force (IAF) conducted an air show at the Blue Flag Beach in Odisha's Puri on Sunday. As per reports, as many as nine aircraft of the Suryakiran Aerobatic Team of the Eastern Air Command conducted the aerobatic display, which was witnessed by thousands of tourists visiting the city.

124.title: Pune student drowns in water tank at Sinhagad Fort
124.article_body: An 18-year-old student of a junior college fell and drowned in a reservoir at the Sinhagad Fort near Pune on Sunday, police said. He was reportedly having a picnic with a group of students and teachers from his college at the fort. The deceased has been identified as a student of Priyadarshani School and Junior College in Pune's Moshi.

125.title: Mass graves found in Ukraine proof of Russia's war crimes: Trudeau
125.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Sunday said that mass graves found in Ukraine were evidence of Russian forces committing war crimes in the country. Russia needs to be held accountable for its actions, Trudeau added. As many as 440 bodies were claimed to be found by Ukrainian authorities this week near a town recaptured from Russian forces.

126.title: The Rock in 'secret talks' to face Roman Reigns in Wrestlemania 39
126.article_body: Dwayne Johnson a.k.a The Rock is reportedly in "secret talks" with WWE over returning for Wrestlemania 39 to face his cousin Roman Reigns. "The Rock is very interested...he is trying to figure out what...to do," said the report. Next year's event is being billed as Wrestlemania Hollywood and will take place in Los Angeles on April 1 and 2.

127.title: Special tourist train to run on Ambedkar Circuit: G Kishan Reddy
127.article_body: A special tourist train will run on the Ambedkar Circuit, Union Tourism and Culture Minister G Kishan Reddy said. He added that almost 3,000 railway coaches were reserved to promote tourism circuits. The Ambedkar Circuit covers Madhya Pradesh's Mhow, the birthplace of Ambedkar; Nagpur, where he converted to Buddhism; his Delhi residence and Maharashtra's Dadar, where his body was cremated.

128.title: Man Utd looking to sign Griezmann in Jan amid Atletico-Barca tussle
128.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly looking to sign forward Antoine Griezmann, who is currently on loan to Atletico Madrid from Barcelona, in January. Atletico are said to be cutting down Griezmann's playing time this season to force Barcelona to lower their £35 million transfer fee demand. Meanwhile, a report claims that Barcelona are interested in signing United's right-back Diogo Dalot.

129.title: Doesn't matter if Stokes and Hales are not friends: England coach
129.article_body: England white-ball coach Matthew Mott said winning the T20 World Cup is the goal and it did not matter if all-rounder Ben Stokes and batter Alex Hales aren't friends. "And as far as that relationship goes, they might not be best mates and that's OK," said Mott. Hales and Stokes were involved in a late-night street brawl in September 2017.

130.title: Had emphasised seat belt use in interview days before Mistry's fatal road accident: Sachin
130.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar, who is currently participating in the Road Safety World Series, said that it is "very unfortunate" that Cyrus Mistry lost his life in a road accident. He added, "It's a coincidence that two-and-a-half weeks before his death, I had said in an interview that wearing of seat belt was the best and unmatched safeguard."

131.title: Hardik Pandya shares video of him dancing with Virat Kohli, fans react
131.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to share a Reel showing him dancing with Virat Kohli on the viral song 'Se Acabo' (Remix). "You know how we do," he captioned the video. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Collab ho to aisa." Another wrote, "Why did Instagram crash?" "Good to see Kohli enjoying," another comment read.

132.title: Was going through anxiety, no one understood my pain: 'Balika...' actor Vikas
132.article_body: 'Balika Vadhu 2' actor Vikas Grover revealed he battled anxiety. "This anxiety you get isn't something that comes to you suddenly, it takes a lot of time to reach you," he added. Vikas revealed his co-stars ignored him when he shared his problem. "No one understood my pain and avoided me...I had to discuss it with my family," he stated.

133.title: Indian badminton duo Dhruv-Arjun wins their 1st international title
133.article_body: World Championships quarterfinalists Dhruv Kapila and MR Arjun registered victories to clinch the men's doubles title at the Maharashtra International Challenge badminton tournament in Nagpur on Sunday. The Indian pair defeated Thailand's badminton pair of Chaloempon Charoenkitamorn and Nanthakarn Yordphaisong by 21-17, 20-22 and 21-18. Notably, this was the pair's first international title.

134.title: Table won't lie after 38 games: Arsenal manager on winning Premier League
134.article_body: Arsenal FC manager Mikel Arteta responded to questions about his team winning the Premier League this season and said, "The table won't lie after 38 games normally." He added that the team should learn from last year's losses and enjoy their football. Arsenal are currently top of the table, having won six out of their seven games in the league.

135.title: Sunil Chhetri-led Bengaluru beat Mumbai for first-ever Durand Cup title
135.article_body: Sunil Chhetri captained the Bengaluru FC to win their first-ever Durand Cup after beating Mumbai FC 2-1 in the finals. Siva Sakthi and Brazilian Alan Costa scored the goals for Bengaluru, while Apuia bagged the lone goal for Mumbai. While Chhetri missed two scoring chances, he provided the assist for the winning goal as Bengaluru got their seventh national title.

136.title: Darul Uloom welcomes UP govt's survey of unrecognised madrasas
136.article_body: Deoband-based Islamic educational institution Darul Uloom has welcomed UP government's decision to survey unrecognised madrasas in the state. Jamiat Ulama-e-Hind President Maulana Arshad Madani said they appreciated the government's initiative but urged the government to not disregard the entire madrasa system if few institutions don't abide by the rules. More than 16,000 madrasas operate in UP.

137.title: Dad Rishi was very critical of Ayan Mukerji's work: Ranbir Kapoor
137.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his late father Rishi Kapoor was "very critical" of 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji's work. Ranbir has previously worked in Ayan's 'Wake Up Sid' and 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani'. Ranbir further stated that Rishi would have been happy on seeing the box office collections of 'Brahmastra'.

138.title: Smriti, Harmanpreet's knocks help India beat England by 7 wickets in 1st ODI
138.article_body: Smriti Mandhana (91), Yastika Bhatia (50) and Harmanpreet Kaur's (74*) fifties helped India Women beat England Women by seven wickets in the first ODI in Hove on Sunday. India pacer Jhulan Goswami, who is playing in her last series before retiring, posted bowling figures of 10-2-20-1. With the win, India have taken a 1-0 lead in the three-match ODI series.

139.title: Bus accident leaves at least 9 dead in Costa Rica
139.article_body: A bus crash in Costa Rica on Saturday night left at least nine people dead, local officials said. The accident was reportedly caused by a landslide triggered by heavy rains. The search for at least 30 missing people is still underway, the office of Costa Rica's president informed.

140.title: Food kept on toilet floor served to players at UP sports camp, pic surfaces
140.article_body: The pictures of food and cooked rice placed on the floor of a toilet in a sports stadium in Saharanpur went viral, sparking controversy. The food was served to around 200 players who were taking part in a camp there. A few players raised the matter before a stadium official. The official informed the sports officer, who reprimanded the cooks.

141.title: Kohli is going to be concern for opposition: Mahela Jayawardena
141.article_body: Former Sri Lankan skipper Mahela Jayawardena said that Indian batter Virat Kohli is going to be a "concern" for the opposition teams in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "In the Asia Cup, he (Kohli) batted well, showed what he is capable of...Going forward for India...having confidence that a guy like Virat is going to be a factor," Jayawardena said.

142.title: Don't criticise selected team, it will demoralise players: Gavaskar
142.article_body: Former India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has said that the Indian team should not be criticised once it has been selected as it will "demoralise" the players. "I believe that this team...can bring home the trophy...it's our India team and we all have to back it," said Gavaskar. He was reportedly responding to criticism by ex-players Mohammad Azharuddin and Dilip Vengsarkar.

143.title: Reported budget figures all wrong, economics of Brahmastra not like other films: Ranbir
143.article_body: Referring to reports speculating Brahmastra's budget, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "The assets we have created for the film, like the fire VFX or effects for other superpowers, they will be used in three films." He added, "It's not like the figures floating around are correct. It's all wrong. The economics of this film isn't like...economics of other films."

144.title: Lovlina, Shiva in India's squad for Asian Boxing Championships
144.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Lovlina Borgohain and five-time Asian medallist Shiva Thapa made it to India's squad for the Asian Boxing Championships to be held in Amman, beginning October 30. The selection trials were held at NIS Patiala from Thursday to Saturday. Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medallists Nitu Ghanghas, Nikhat Zareen and Amit Panghal skipped the trials.

145.title: Pakistani drone spotted in J&K's Samba, search carried out
145.article_body: The Special Operations Group (SOG) of the J&K Police conducted a search operation near the border areas of the Samba district after villagers informed them of a possible Pakistani drone being present. "The drone was...at least 1 kilometre above the ground," said DSP of the SOG. He added that Pakistan had earlier landed arms and ammunition in India via drones.

146.title: Strip her & film her: Chandigarh University warden while scolding girl who leaked videos
146.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a Chandigarh University hostel warden scolding the girl student who allegedly leaked objectionable videos of other female students. "Strip her naked and film her," the female warden is heard telling other girls in the hostel. The warden is also heard threatening to hit the girl and telling her that she will be suspended.

147.title: Brahmastra reminded me of shows like Mahabharat, Ramayan: Nagarjuna
147.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna Akkineni has said Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra' reminded him of mythological shows such as 'Mahabharat' and 'Ramayan'. "I'd seen in Mahabharat where they had used these astras...and that interested me," he added. "When he (Ayan) was telling me all these things, I was happy...somebody in India is making this. It took me back to all those memories," said Nagarjuna.

148.title: I was surprised to know how down to earth Dhoni was: Varun Aaron
148.article_body: Indian pacer Varun Aaron said that he was "pleasantly surprised to know how down to earth" and approachable former skipper MS Dhoni was when the former met him for the first time. "If Dhoni does well, or he doesn't have the greatest game, he is still the same," he said. Notably, Aaron and Dhoni have represented Jharkhand in domestic cricket.

149.title: Fiona develops into hurricane as it approaches Puerto Rico
149.article_body: Tropical storm Fiona advanced into a hurricane as it moved toward Puerto Rico on Sunday, according to the US National Hurricane Center (NHC). The maximum sustained wind speed recorded was near 130 km/h, clearing the threshold for hurricane strength, the NHC said. Puerto Rico is expected to receive up to 25 inches (63.5 cm) of rain.

150.title: I have faced casting couch: 'Siya' actress Pooja Pandey
150.article_body: Pooja Pandey, who currently stars in Manish Mundra's directorial 'Siya', has revealed that she faced casting couch in the film industry. "I have blocked around 150 contacts on my phone because of that," she added. Speaking about the film, Pooja said she cried while hearing the narration. "[I] found relatability in the character," she added.

151.title: SBI waives off SMS charges on mobile fund transfers
151.article_body: India's largest lender State Bank of India (SBI) on Sunday took to Twitter and announced that it has waived off SMS charges on mobile fund transfers. "Users can now conveniently transact without any additional charges using USSD services," it tweeted. Users will eventually feel less burdened and mobile fund transfers will become more affordable and practical, it added.

152.title: Paarl Royals appoint David Miller as captain for inaugural SA20 league
152.article_body: David Miller has been named Paarl Royals captain for inaugural season of SA20, Cricket South Africa's T20 league. "It makes me immensely proud to have been appointed as the captain of...Paarl Royals. To be able to call it my home, gives me great joy," said Miller. The team is owned by Royals Sports Group, owners of IPL franchise RR.

153.title: Nehra is chilled out, invested in every single player: Varun Aaron
153.article_body: Indian pacer Varun Aaron said that his IPL franchise Gujarat Titans' head coach, Ashish Nehra, is a "very chilled out" person. "He (Nehra) is...always there when you need him, want to have a chat late at night or want to have an extra session in the nets," Aaron said. He added that Nehra is "very much invested" in each player.

154.title: NITI Aayog-like body to be set up in Maha for data analysis: Fadnavis
154.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said an institution on the lines of NITI Aayog will be set up in the state for comprehensive data analysis and to make studied decisions on various sectors. "CM Eknath Shinde has given an in-principle nod to this suggestion," Fadnavis added. A delegation led by Shinde met NITI Aayog's CEO and other officials on Sunday.

155.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz reminds me of Nadal when he was that age: Ferrer
155.article_body: Praising Carlos Alcaraz, Spain's David Ferrer said his 19-year-old compatriot is a special player. "He reminds me of Rafael Nadal when he was that age, that way of assuming pressure, he had no problem with that," he added. Alcaraz won his maiden Grand Slam at US Open last week and became the youngest men's world number one in tennis history.

156.title: Everybody needs to realise that nobody is above the law: Vice Prez
156.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar said that everyone needs to realise that nobody is above the law. Speaking at the '1st Justice JS Verma Memorial Lecture', VP Dhankhar said, "It is a matter of joy that the Central and state governments together are making serious efforts to empower tribals [in Madhya Pradesh]."

157.title: Tesla planning to double vehicle sales in Germany in 2022: Report
157.article_body: Electric vehicle manufacturer Tesla is aiming to double its vehicle sales in Germany this year, according to a report. Speaking to a German weekly publication, a local executive said, "Our goal is to double sales each year, which translates into around 80,000 units in 2022." Last year, Tesla made 39,714 vehicle sales in Germany.

158.title: Video shows UP policeman slapping man who complained of missing niece
158.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows a police inspector slapping a man who had gone to a police station to complain about his niece missing for four days. The Inspector, who is in-charge of Baghpat's Binauli Police Station, was transferred and a departmental inquiry was initiated against him. The man was accompanied by his family members.

159.title: 3 killed, 1 injured as mud house collapses in J&K's Anantnag
159.article_body: Three people have died and one was injured after a mud house collapsed in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district, officials said. The Lieutenant Governor of J&K Manoj Sinha expressed condolences to the bereaved families and Anantnag Deputy Commissioner issued ex-gratia of ₹50,000 each to the victims' families. Sinha asked the district administration to ensure that immediate assistance was provided.

160.title: Case filed against ex-K'taka CM Yediyurappa on corruption charges
160.article_body: Karnataka's Lokayukta Police filed a case against former CM BS Yediyurappa and his family members in a corruption case. An FIR was filed against Yediyurappa, his son BY Vijayendra (the BJP state vice president), his grandson and the then Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) commissioner. The complaint alleged that in return for granting BDA contracts, the accused got bribes.

161.title: Man forces pet dog to run behind car by holding its leash while driving in Rajasthan
161.article_body: A video showing a pet dog being forced to run behind a car by its owner who is driving the vehicle in Rajasthan has surfaced on Twitter. The man, identified as a popular Jodhpur-based surgeon Dr Rajneesh Galwa, is seen holding the dog's leash while driving the car. A case has been registered against Dr Galwa over the incident.

162.title: RBI will take steps to keep inflation in reasonable range: Sanyal
162.article_body: Sanjeev Sanyal, a member of the Economic Advisory Council to the PM, said that the RBI's Monetary Policy Committee will take responsible steps to keep inflation in a reasonable range. Sanyal said that India's inflation is at 7%, pointing out that in several countries inflation is much higher than ours. "I've to commend...MPC and...Finance Ministry for managing it," he added.

163.title: Keanu Reeves to return for sequel to 2005 film 'Constantine': Reports
163.article_body: Actor Keanu Reeves is all set to return as John Constantine in the sequel to his film 'Constantine', according to reports. Francis Lawrence, who directed the first part, has been roped in to helm the upcoming sequel, as per reports. 'Constantine', which was released in 2005, also featured Rachel Weisz, Shia LaBeouf and Djimon Hounsou.

164.title: Karan Johar responds to Twitter user questioning Brahmastra's logic
164.article_body: Referring to a scene in 'Brahmastra', a user questioned the movie's logic, stating, "Tell me how...Ashram is secret and address of ashram is on Google Maps?" Filmmaker Karan Johar responded, "Guru's living like any other person in...real world...no one knows he's the leader of...Brahmansh! That His is the house of...Astras...so his address...in...real world is of course on Google Maps!”

165.title: Must do sequels if writing is good, I'm confident about Gadar 2: Sunny
165.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has said that he is confident about his upcoming film 'Gadar 2'. "We mess things up while doing part two. If the writing is good, we must do a part two...we shouldn't make it just for the sake of it," Sunny further added. The film will be the sequel to the 2001 film 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha'.

166.title: Never went looking for roles in B'wood, they came for me: Nagarjuna
166.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna, who recently featured in Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra', has said that he always did special roles in Bollywood films. "Whatever I have done right from the beginning, it was important for me to entertain people. All the roles that I did, came looking for me, I never (went for them)," he added. Nagarjuna stated he likes living in Hyderabad.

167.title: Top Vatican envoy comes under attack in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia
167.article_body: A top Vatican envoy and his entourage came under fire as they were distributing humanitarian aid in the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia on Saturday, Vatican News reported. The incident forced Vatican City's Almoner Cardinal Konrad Krajewski and others to take cover. No injuries were, however, reported. The office of the Almoner makes charitable contributions in the name of the Pope.

168.title: 1 dead, 5 injured after wild elephants attack villagers in Assam
168.article_body: A man was trampled to death and five others were seriously injured by a herd of wild elephants in Assam's Baksa, officials said on Sunday. According to villagers, the herd had entered an area from a nearby forest searching for food. The incident took place when the villagers tried to frighten the animals in an attempt to make them retreat.

169.title: Malayalam film 'Udal' to be remade in Hindi, Naseeruddin to play lead: Report
169.article_body: Ratheesh Reghunandan's directorial 'Udal', a Malayalam-language film starring Indrans and Durga Krishna among others, will reportedly be remade in Hindi. According to the report, Naseeruddin Shah has been roped in to play the lead role in the film, which will be helmed by Ratheesh himself. Naseeruddin will reportedly play the role of a visually-impaired man in the revenge thriller.

170.title: Police holds talks with Chandigarh University students amid protests
170.article_body: Punjab Police and Mohali district administration held talks with women students from Chandigarh University amid protests over "objectionable videos" of college hostellers being recorded by a student. Additional DGP Gurpreet Deo said the students are now happy as their concerns have been addressed. Women students were perturbed at the alleged circulation of videos on social media, she added.

171.title: Bus set on fire near WB's Siliguri after local dies in accident
171.article_body: A bus belonging to the Sikkim transport department was set on fire on National Highway 31 near West Bengal's Siliguri after it ran over a local resident on Sunday afternoon. The deceased was returning home on his two-wheeler when the bus hit him from the opposite direction. Locals even stopped firefighters from dousing the flames, police said.

172.title: 1 soldier killed in militant attack near Syrian border: Turkey
172.article_body: One Turkish soldier was killed and another was injured in a rocket attack carried out by militants near the Syrian border on Sunday, Turkey's Defence Ministry said. Notably, the attack took place in an area which is known for fighting between Turkish forces and the Syrian Kurdish YPG militia. The ministry added that 12 militants were neutralised in retaliatory strikes.

173.title: Bitcoin falls below $20,000, down 58.9% from year's high of $48,234
173.article_body: The world's biggest cryptocurrency, Bitcoin, fell below $20,000 on Sunday. Bitcoin is down 0.44% in the last 24 hours and is currently trading at $19,817.55, losing $310 from its previous close. Its value saw a drop of 58.9% from the year's high of $48,234 it hit in March. Meanwhile, Ethereum, the second-largest digital currency, dropped 1.45% to $1,421.14 on Sunday.

174.title: Jacqueline summoned by Delhi Police again in ₹200-cr money laundering case
174.article_body: The Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing has summoned actress Jacqueline Fernandez again at 11 am on Monday for questioning in the ₹200-crore money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. Jacqueline was questioned in the case for over eight hours and was given a list of 100 questions on September 14. Actress Nora Fatehi was also questioned in the case.
