175.title: Chandigarh University incident is very unfortunate: Sonu Sood
175.article_body: After protests erupted in Chandigarh University over leaked videos of 60 girls taking baths in the hostel, actor Sonu Sood has said that the incident is "very unfortunate". Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "It's time for us to stand with our sisters and set an example of a responsible society. These are testing times for us, not for the victims."

176.title: Inox Green Energy plans launch of ₹740 cr IPO in 30-45 days: CEO
176.article_body: Inox Wind subsidiary, Inox Green Energy Services, has decided to launch its ₹740 crore Initial Public Offering (IPO) by October this year, CEO Kailash Lal Tarachandani said. The IPO includes equity shares worth ₹370 crore and an offer-for-sale of equity stocks of almost ₹370 crore by Inox Wind. This is the second time the company has decided to go public.

177.title: Man working as auto driver wins ₹25cr lottery in Kerala a day after seeking ₹3 lakh loan
177.article_body: A man employed as an autorickshaw driver on Sunday won a ₹25 crore lottery in Kerala, just a day after he applied for a ₹3 lakh loan to go to Malaysia to work as a chef. Anoop said he has cancelled plans to go to Malaysia and will instead buy a house. He will get ₹15 crore after tax deduction.

178.title: TV actress Nishi Singh passes away aged 50
178.article_body: TV actress Nishi Singh, who appeared in TV shows such as 'Ishqbaaaz', 'Qubool Hai' and 'Tenali Rama', passed away on Sunday at the age of 50. She had suffered three strokes of paralysis in the last few years. She is survived by her husband, writer-actor Sanjay Singh Bhadli, and their two children.

179.title: Man, 5-year-old son killed as CNG truck catches fire in Gujarat
179.article_body: A man and his minor son were killed after their CNG-powered mini truck caught fire in Navagam village in Gujarat's Surendranagar district. The deceased, Lalji Khorani (50) and Amit (5), were burnt to death before farmers working in the nearby agricultural fields rushed to the spot. The mini truck caught fire suddenly when it was negotiating a curve, police said.

180.title: Was pretty put off: Ayesha Jhulka on being replaced in 'Narsimha'
180.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka revealed she was "pretty put off" after she was replaced in the 1991 film 'Narsimha'. "It was quite a controversy, it made it to the headlines that Ayesha Jhulka was replaced, that hurt me a lot," she stated. "More than anything it hurt me because I had not even begun...I was thrown out of films," Ayesha added.

181.title: They need confidence: Jayawardena on India ahead of T20 World Cup
181.article_body: Commenting on Team India's form ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said India have the skill and talent but they need a little bit of confidence with the bat, ball and in the field. India failed to qualify for Asia Cup 2022 final. They lost to Pakistan and Sri Lanka in the Super 4 stage.

182.title: FPIs invest ₹12,000 crore in Indian equities between Sept 1-16
182.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested ₹12,000 crore in the Indian equity markets between September 1-16, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs turned net buyers for first time in July after nine straight months of net outflows, selling ₹2.46 lakh crore from Indian equities between October 2021-June 2022. They had invested ₹51,200 crore in August 2022 in Indian equities.

183.title: Binance misallocates 4.8 mn Helium's HNT coins worth $20 mn: Report
183.article_body: Binance misallocated about $20 million worth of Helium's HNT coins to its customers, Coindesk reported. Binance has misallocated about 4.8 million HNT tokens, many of which were quickly sold for profit by users. The error possibly occurred as Binance mistakenly counted Helium's HNT and MOBILE tokens as one. "We can confirm that this isn't a chain issue," Helium Foundation said.

184.title: India created 80 lakh jobs in frontline industry in FY 2022: Report
184.article_body: Over 80 lakh jobs were created in the frontline industry in the financial year 2022 in India, according to BetterPlace Frontline Index Report. The e-commerce sector contributed the highest to the need for frontline workers, followed by the logistics and mobility sectors, the report said. The average monthly salaries reportedly grew marginally from ₹21,664 in FY21 to ₹22,800 in FY22.

185.title: He was always really humble: Lara recalls meeting Roger Federer
185.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta, recalling meeting Roger Federer who recently announced his retirement from professional tennis, said that he was "always really humble". She also recalled how Federer "stood up immediately" to shake hands with her husband, former tennis player Mahesh Bhupathi's father after the latter went to him to say hello. "It just spoke volumes about...his upbringing," said Lara.

186.title: Excise Dept bulldozes expired beer bottles worth ₹1.5 crore in MP
186.article_body: The Excise Department in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal destroyed thousands of beer bottles worth ₹1.5 crore using a bulldozer. According to the department, the liquor bottles were destroyed as they had expired more than six months ago. Further investigation is underway to ascertain if some of the expired bottles were sold in the market, as per reports.

187.title: Interfaith couple attacked by Bajrang Dal get married in K'taka
187.article_body: An interfaith couple arrived at a sub-registrar's office in Karnataka and legally registered their marriage a week after they were allegedly attacked by Bajrang Dal activists. The couple said they were childhood friends and did not intend to change their religion. Police reportedly provided security to the couple and took them to the police station after the attack.

188.title: Team India's new jersey launched ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, pic released
188.article_body: Team India's new T20I kit called 'One Blue Jersey' has been launched ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. The new jersey has a lighter shade of blue. The jersey was launched by BCCI and Team India's official kit sponsor, MPL Sports, at an event in Mumbai. Team India are expected to wear the jersey starting with T20I series against Australia.

189.title: Arsenal regain top Premier League spot with 3-0 win over Brentford
189.article_body: Arsenal regained top spot in the Premier League standings with a 3-0 win over Brentford on Sunday. Both William Saliba and Gabriel Jesus scored in the first half. Fabio Vieira, on his full Premier League debut, scored the third in the 49th minute. Arsenal have 18 points from seven matches. They are one point ahead of Manchester City and Tottenham.

190.title: BJP wins in West Bengal's Nandigram cooperative body polls
190.article_body: BJP won the polls in a cooperative body in Nandigram in West Bengal's Purba Medinipur district. The saffron party won 11 of the 12 seats of Bhekutia Samabay Krishi Samity. Notably, TMC, which earlier ruled the cooperative body, won only a single seat, a district official said. The MLA from the Nandigram constituency is BJP's Suvendu Adhikari.

191.title: 8-ft-long python swallows goat in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve
191.article_body: An eight-foot-long python swallowed a goat in a village in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve, a forest official said on Sunday. The python, which was not able to move, was rescued by a four-member team with help of villagers and was later released into the forest. The goat was in a maize field when the python attacked and swallowed it.

192.title: I'm sorry I killed the characters so easily: 'Squid Game' director
192.article_body: 'Squid Game' director Hwang Dong-hyuk, speaking about season 2 of the series, has said he feels sorry for easily killing many characters in the first season. "I want to revive Ji-young, but her best friend Sae-byeok also died, so I'm thinking what to do," he stated. The upcoming season is expected to release in 2024.

193.title: There's no way Kohli has to open batting for India in T20 WC: Hayden
193.article_body: Sharing his opinion on whether Virat Kohli should open the batting for India in upcoming T20 World Cup, Matthew Hayden said, "There's no way that he has to open the batting, he has to bat at number three, [as] simple as that." Kohli recently scored 122* in Asia Cup 2022 while opening against Afghanistan. It was Kohli's first-ever T20I century.

194.title: Death toll due to Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan border clashes reach 81
194.article_body: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan on Sunday updated their death tolls from the latest bout of border skirmishes between them, putting the combined figure at 81. Tajik and Kyrgyz forces clashed multiple times from September 14-16. Both sides have accused each other of using heavy weaponry such as tanks and mortars. A fragile ceasefire between the two countries is currently in effect.

195.title: Where and when will Queen Elizabeth be laid to rest tomorrow?
195.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II will be laid to rest at St George's Chapel located inside Windsor Castle in Berkshire, UK tomorrow. Her coffin will be transported to her final resting place in the chapel after a state funeral at the Westminster Abbey in London. The funeral is scheduled to begin at 3:30 PM (IST) and is expected to last an hour.

196.title: OTT has changed things for me: Tisca Chopra
196.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said in an interview that OTT has changed things for her. She added that OTT is a very democratic medium since the sustainability of an actor only depends on their ability to perform a given job. "It is very liberating as an actor. It is definitely going to be a great decade ahead," Tisca further said.

197.title: Language isn't barrier now, people watch films with subtitles: Naga
197.article_body: Speaking about the North vs South debate, actor Naga Chaitanya said language is not a barrier anymore and people watch films with subtitles. Naga further stated that nothing is going wrong with Bollywood. "The audience picks the content they can relate to the most. If there's an emotional connection, they'll make it win, be it in any language," he added.

198.title: Azerbaijan rebukes Pelosi over remarks on conflict with Armenia
198.article_body: Azerbaijan on Sunday criticised US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi for blaming Baku for the renewed fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan. "Unsubstantiated and unfair accusations levelled by Pelosi...are unacceptable," Azerbaijan's foreign ministry said. Her remarks dealt a "serious blow" to efforts aimed at normalisation of ties between Armenia and Azerbaijan, the ministry added.

199.title: Our timelines couldn't match: Ali on not directing Salman, Katrina's Tiger 3
199.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar, who helmed 'Tiger Zinda Hai', spoke about not directing 'Tiger 3' which stars Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif. "Adi (producer Aditya Chopra) is like an elder brother...When the third part of 'Tiger' was happening I'd some engagements that I was committed to. Our timelines couldn't match," he said. 'Tiger 3' is being helmed by Maneesh Sharma.

200.title: Chandigarh University announces non-teaching days on Sept 19 & 20 amid protests
200.article_body: Amid huge protests over the video leak incident on its campus, Chandigarh University on Sunday declared September 19 (Monday) and 20 (Tuesday) as non-teaching days for students due to some "unavoidable reasons". However, all faculty and staff members of academic and non-academic departments will report as usual. A notification added that other essential services will continue.

201.title: ONGC bats to remove windfall tax, use dividend to tap into earnings
201.article_body: State-owned ONGC, India's top producer of oil and gas, wants the central government to remove windfall profit tax on crude oil that is produced domestically. Instead, ONGC wants that the dividend be used to tap into earnings from surge in global energy prices. It also said that levying windfall tax was unfair while reaping savings from purchasing discounted Russian oil.

202.title: Shimla man who got 'objectionable videos' from Chandigarh University student arrested
202.article_body: A man from Shimla has been arrested in connection to the leak of objectionable videos of Chandigarh University's female students, police said on Sunday. This is the second arrest in the case as a girl student, who allegedly made the videos and sent them to the apprehended man, was arrested earlier. Police said the arrested student sent her own video.

203.title: NCW writes to Punjab Police over Chandigarh University video leak incident
203.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) on Sunday wrote to Punjab DGP to immediately file an FIR into the video leak incident at Chandigarh University. NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma also wrote to the university vice chancellor to take stringent action against the accused. Massive protests erupted on the university campus over alleged rumours of objectionable videos of women students being recorded.

204.title: Noida policemen take bribe to let off drug trafficking suspect; 3 suspended
204.article_body: Three Noida Police personnel have been suspended and one of them has been arrested for allegedly taking money from a person to let him off the hook in a drug trafficking case. The accused officials were posted at the Sector 57 outpost and action was initiated after a video purportedly showing a constable taking a ₹20,000 bribe went viral.

205.title: Kohli will be a challenge this next week: Cummins ahead of India-Aus T20Is
205.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli ahead of India-Australia T20I series, Australia pacer Pat Cummins said the India batter is going to be a challenge in the next week. On Kohli ending his 1,019-day international century drought at recently concluded Asia Cup 2022, Cummins said, "He's a class player, he was always going to return to form at some point in time."

206.title: Indian man flies to Dubai to buy iPhone 14, spends ₹40,000 on tickets & visa
206.article_body: A 28-year-old Kerala man flew to Dubai to be among the first few Indians to buy iPhone 14 Pro, just hours before its sale began in India on Friday (September 16). Dheeraj Palliyil bought its 512 GB storage model for ₹1,29,000. This was the fourth time that Palliyil purchased the latest iPhone on its first day of sale in Dubai.

207.title: President Murmu pays tribute to Queen in London, signs condolence book; pics surface
207.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday visited Westminster Hall in London, where the body of Queen Elizabeth II is lying in state. President Murmu offered tributes on her own behalf and on behalf of the people of India, the President’s Secretariat tweeted. She also signed the condolence book in the memory of the Queen Elizabeth II at Lancaster House in London.

208.title: Ex-students held for crude bomb explosion on roof of Bengal school
208.article_body: Police on Sunday arrested four boys, aged between 17 and 18, for allegedly throwing a crude bomb on the roof of a school in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas during class hours on Saturday. "Three of the accused are former students of the school...Ten similar crude bombs were seized from the home of one of the suspects," an officer said.

209.title: 7 Bihar policemen including SHOs hurt as mob attacks police station
209.article_body: Seven police personnel, including two Station House Officers (SHOs), were critically injured after a group of villagers attacked the Pranpur police station in Bihar's Katihar district on Saturday, hours after the death of a man allegedly in custody. Hundreds of villagers allegedly damaged vehicles parked on the premises. The deceased was arrested on Friday for possessing bottles of liquor.

210.title: Powerful typhoon with 230 kmph wind speed hits Japan
210.article_body: A powerful typhoon 'Nanmadol' with wind speed of over 230 kmph made landfall in southwestern Japan on Sunday. The Japan Meteorological Agency issued special warning for Kagoshima Prefecture. Notably, such warnings are only issued when "extraordinary" natural phenomenon occurring once in a few decades is predicted in the country. The typhoon officially made landfall at around 7 pm (local time).

211.title: There can't be Opp'n unity without Congress as its fulcrum: Jairam Ramesh
211.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said there cannot be any Opposition unity without "Congress as its fulcrum". "If any non-BJP outfit thinks any alliance sans Congress can provide a stable government for five years, it's living in a fool's paradise. There can never be any Opposition unity minus Congress," Ramesh added. Many regional parties have back-stabbed Congress, he said.

212.title: Congress to fight civic polls in Pune alone: Arvind Shinde
212.article_body: Congress' Pune unit chief Arvind Shinde has announced that the party will contest the upcoming civic elections for Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) alone, without allying with NCP or Shiv Sena. "We have asked all aspirants wanting to contest polls and other workers to start preparing for elections and focus on strengthening the party at ward level," said Shinde.

213.title: Rajasthan man in ICU after alleged brutality during police custody
213.article_body: A man from Rajasthan's Sikar district is in the ICU ward after allegedly being beaten up in police custody and made to do 500 sit-ups. The victim's family submitted a memorandum to the Superintendent of Police, who has ordered a probe into the matter. The SP said the accused had been undergoing kidney dialysis and doctors have reported no injuries.

214.title: Egypt to increase transit fees for ships using Suez Canal
214.article_body: Egypt on Saturday said that it will be raising the transit fees for ships passing through the Suez Canal from January 1 next year. The Suez Canal Authority said that a 15% hike will be imposed for tankers carrying oil and petroleum products. For dry bulk carriers and cruise ships, transit fees will be increased by 10%, the authority added.

215.title: God sent AAP to end corruption like Krishna was sent to end evil: Kejriwal
215.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said, "Like lord Krishna was sent to end evil, god has sent AAP to end corruption, inflation, unemployment and save the constitution and country from evils." He was speaking at AAP's first national convention on Sunday. Around 1,500 elected representatives of AAP from around 20 states were present.

216.title: Man shoots dog dead for barking at him in Bengaluru; case filed
216.article_body: A man shot a dog in the head with an air gun for barking at him in Bengaluru's Maragondanahalli on Sunday. According to police, the accused, Krishnappa, had followed the dog before shooting it in the village. The dog was nursed by Harish, who belonged to the same village. Harish later lodged a complaint with police over the incident.

217.title: It'd be special: Murray on playing with Federer in Swiss' last event at Laver Cup
217.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray said playing with Roger Federer in the 20-time Grand Slam champion's last tournament at next week's Laver Cup would be "special". "I don't know how much he'll be able to play...haven't spoken to him about that," he added. The 41-year-old Swiss announced that he'll retire after Laver Cup. Murray and Federer will represent Team Europe.

218.title: Current policy stance should continue, expect more rate hikes: Ex-RBI Guv
218.article_body: RBI's current policy stance should continue, said former RBI Governor C Rangarajan. "Developed countries are also taking steep rate hikes. I expect more rate hikes," Rangarajan added. He further said there was a steep fall in INR's value against USD with the outflow of capital. "Now, with the inflow of capital, value of INR is expected to strengthen," he added.

219.title: US court bars social media firms from censoring users on 'viewpoint'
219.article_body: A US appeals court on Friday upheld a Texas law barring social media firms from banning or censoring users based on "viewpoint". The firms that challenged the law included the Computer and Communications Industry Association, which counts Facebook, Twitter and YouTube as its members. Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton hailed the ruling as a "massive victory for...free speech".

220.title: ATS detains Maoist with 31 cases, ₹15 lakh reward in Mumbai's Nalasopara
220.article_body: The Maharashtra ATS has detained an alleged member of the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) from Mumbai's Nalasopara. The man had come for medical treatment from Jharkhand and is said to have 31 cases, including 11 murders, filed against him. ATS said the man carries a reward of ₹15 lakh and will be handed over to Jharkhand Police.

221.title: Digital market distortions need to be quickly fixed: CCI Chairman
221.article_body: Competition Commission of India Chairperson Ashok Kumar Gupta said the distortions in the digital market need to be corrected promptly. Stating that digital platforms are in a position to influence consumer choices, he said the gatekeeper position of these platforms is raising competition concerns. He added that the regulatory framework also needed to adapt to reflect digital market complexities.

222.title: BJP trying to crush AAP in name of fighting corruption: Kejriwal
222.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "crush" the AAP in the name of fighting corruption. Kejriwal further alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government has been trying to frame his party leaders and ministers in false corruption cases as the BJP is "not able to digest the growing popularity of the AAP in Gujarat".

223.title: Net direct tax collections in FY23 surge 23% YoY to over ₹7 lakh cr
223.article_body: Net direct tax collections in FY23 have surged 23% YoY to over ₹7 lakh crore against ₹5.68 lakh crore collected in FY22, according to data from the Central Board of Direct Taxes. While ₹3.68 lakh crore was collected as corporation tax, ₹3.30 lakh crore was collected as income tax. Refunds worth ₹1.35 lakh crore have been issued till September 17.

224.title: You made my day: Mrunal to Polish fan who praised her performance in 'Sita...'
224.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur reacted to a letter sent by a Polish fan to the team of 'Sita Ramam'. In the letter, the fan praised Mrunal's performance in the film, saying that she can't imagine anyone else playing Sita. "I can't express in words how happy I am! You certainly made my day...a big thank you," Mrunal wrote.

225.title: Without jobs there is no future: Rahul Gandhi
225.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that the "Bharat Jodo Yatra is uniting the voices of despair to break the shackles of unemployment". "Without harmony, there is no progress...Without progress, there are no jobs...Without jobs, there is no future," Rahul said. The 52-year-old politician is currently participating in over 5-month long 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

226.title: Should only be inspired by it: Ranbir on Alia working during pregnancy
226.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about his wife and actress Alia Bhatt working during her pregnancy, has said that people should only be inspired by it. "Any kind of criticism is just jealousy and mischief makers and stupidity and we should not take that seriously," he added. The 'Brahmastra' actress announced her pregnancy in June.

227.title: There was no sense of hierarchy with Kriti Sanon, Kartik Aaryan: Ankur
227.article_body: Speaking about working with Kriti Sanon and Kartik Aaryan in 'Shehzada', actor Ankur Rathee has said that there was no hierarchy. "We think that once you achieve stardom, you keep everyone at an arm's length distance. But with Kriti...Kartik, I didn't feel it at all," he added. Ankur stated Kriti and Kartik were "welcoming" when he arrived on the set.

228.title: Om Puri used to get angry if we shot after midnight: Sudhir Mishra
228.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra recalled that late actor Om Puri would get angry if they shot after midnight. He added, "He would be angry but would say, 'Chal ghar pe [Let's go home], I'll feed you bhindi'. My films are mostly set in night, so he would get angry!" Sudhir went on to call Om a "graceful" and "generous" person.

229.title: It'll be made, he has given me a hefty amount: Farah on film with Rohit
229.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan, while sharing an update on her upcoming project with Rohit Shetty, said, "Our film will be made but that's all I can say at this moment." She added that Rohit has given her a "hefty signing amount" and is refusing to take it back. The upcoming comedy entertainer will be produced by Rohit and directed by Farah.

230.title: He has proven himself: Rohit on Umesh's inclusion in India's T20I team vs Aus
230.article_body: Explaining the reason behind Umesh Yadav's selection in India's squad for upcoming three-match T20I series against Australia, India captain Rohit Sharma said the 34-year-old pacer is a quality bowler and has proven himself. Umesh was named as Mohammad Shami's replacement for the series after the pacer tested positive for COVID-19. Umesh last played a T20I in February 2019.

231.title: Condition of roads under my dept extremely bad: Maha PWD Minister
231.article_body: Maharashtra PWD Minister Ravindra Chavan said the condition of roads under his department is "extremely bad" with 40% of the roads being "in their worst condition". "If I am to ensure that all 98,000-kilometre roads are improved...then I will require ₹2 lakh crore," said Chavan. He added that PWD now needs to concentrate on the quality of roads over quantity.

232.title: Amanatullah Khan's supporters booked for heckling, obstructing ACB
232.article_body: A case has reportedly been filed against AAP leader Amanatullah Khan's supporters for heckling officers of the Delhi Anti-Corruption Bureau and causing obstruction during government work. Delhi Police lodged two FIRs against the AAP MLA's aides Hamid Ali and Kausar Imam Siddique. Khan was arrested and sent to four-day custody in connection with alleged corruption in the Delhi Waqf Board.

233.title: Chandigarh University girl sent only her video to boyfriend, other girls panicked: Police
233.article_body: Referring to reported leak of videos of around 60 Chandigarh University girls taking baths, the police stated that the accused girl sent only her video to her boyfriend in Shimla. "Other girls in the hostel saw the accused shooting her own video...They panicked and thought she shot the videos of all others,” Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said.

234.title: No objection to survey of madrassas by UP govt: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
234.article_body: Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's President Maulana Arshad Madani has said there's no objection from the madrassas on the issue of the survey of unrecognised madrassas by Uttar Pradesh government. "There's no anger in...Muslim society about the survey," he said. "[Government] can do whatever it feels is in the national interest but there should be no efforts to target...Muslims," he added.

235.title: Leopard cub with no injury marks found dead inside Mumbai's Film City
235.article_body: A leopard cub, with no visible injury marks, was found dead inside Mumbai's Film City on Sunday. Forest officials dispatched a team to figure out the cause of death after they got a call around 10:30 am on Sunday. The Sanjay Gandhi National Park, which is home to a number of leopards, is near Film City's Goregaon location.

236.title: Dams reduce water release, bring relief for Pune's low-lying areas
236.article_body: Owing to reduced rainfall activity in the catchments, dams in the vicinity of Pune have decreased their water release, bringing relief for low-lying areas that were on flood alert. PMC authorities have said that the relocation of residents in these areas has been put on hold. The state irrigation agency said that precipitation was still entering the dams on Saturday.

237.title: India 2 spots down in global crypto adoption, ranks 4th in 2022: Report
237.article_body: India slid two spots on the list of countries with highest adoption of cryptocurrencies in 2022 to the fourth position, research published by Chainalysis showed. Vietnam holds the top position, followed by the Philippines, Ukraine and the US in the second, third and fifth positions. China has ranked among top 10 countries this year after being ranked 13th last year.

238.title: 1st conviction under UP's new anti-conversion law as man gets 5-year jail term
238.article_body: In a first, a court in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha has served a five-year jail term to a 26-year-old man under the Uttar Pradesh Prohibition of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Act, 2021. The accused was arrested under the anti-conversion law for allegedly kidnapping a 16-year-old girl from another community last year. The state introduced the anti-conversion law in December 2021.

239.title: IRS officer allegedly beats Pune trader with pipes, probe ordered
239.article_body: A Pune-based scrap trader has filed a complaint alleging that a top-ranking Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer posted at the Pune GST Commissionerate physically assaulted him with plastic pipes over GST penalty issues. The victim alleged that he was forced to accept GST liability which he denied. Meanwhile, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta has ordered an inquiry into the case.

240.title: JBM Auto cheated of over ₹1 crore after CFO receives fake WhatsApp messages
240.article_body: JBM Auto, a listed company, was cheated of over ₹1 crore after its CFO Vivek Gupta received fake WhatsApp messages from fraudsters posing as the company's Vice Chairman Nishant Arya. Gupta said he was asked to transfer money in seven accounts. "Since, I was informed...[Arya] is busy in an important meeting, I couldn't...call to make any further enquiry," he added.

241.title: Ponniyin Selvan 2 will release in next 9 months, says director Ratnam
241.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has confirmed that the second instalment of the 'Ponniyin Selvan' will release in the next nine months. The first instalment, which features actors Vikram and Karthi, will release on September 30. The first instalment also features actresses Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Trisha Krishnan. The film is based on the book 'Ponniyin Selvan'.

242.title: J&K LG inaugurates cinema halls, calls it a 'historic day'
242.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha inaugurated multipurpose cinema halls in Pulwama and Shopian, calling it a "historic day". The Union Territory has got cinema halls after three decades and three years after the abrogation of Article 370. "It offers facilities ranging from movie screening, infotainment and skilling of youth," the LG tweeted.

243.title: Russia offering $3,000/month to those willing to fight in Ukraine
243.article_body: Russia's army is offering nearly $3,000 (₹2,38,951) per month to those willing to enlist as "contract" soldiers for the war in Ukraine. An officer associated with the recruitment of such soldiers said that Russians and foreigners aged 18-60 years would be eligible for enlistment. Reportedly, the minimum monthly wage on offer is $2,700 (₹2,15,056), which is thrice the national average.

244.title: Chhattisgarh Congress passes resolution backing Rahul as party chief
244.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Pradesh Congress Committee passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as the party President. "Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan have made this proposal. It has been done in two states but if this proposal comes from other states, then Rahul ji should rethink about this matter," said Chhattisgarh CM. The Congress Presidential election will be held on October 17.

245.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts for next 2 days
245.article_body: Some areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm on September 19 (Monday) and September 20 (Tuesday). The power outage is planned due to some repair and maintenance work undertaken by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited. The areas that will be affected due to power cuts include Wilson Garden and Shanti Nagar.

246.title: Scientists develop laughter model to make robots more human
246.article_body: Scientists at Japan's Kyoto University have developed a model of shared laughter to make robots more human. Scientists incorporated the model into Android Erica, a humanlike robot, to help it choose between solo laughs, social laughs and gleeful laughter. The model combines all three laughters rather than just detecting a laughter and responding to it, said the research's lead author.

247.title: UP's law & order situation an example for country, world: CM Yogi
247.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said law and order of UP is being seen as an example for the country and the world. People often discuss UP's law and order situation as an example of the state where riots, anarchy and hooliganism were considered to be at their peak before 2017 but now the rule of law has been established there.

248.title: 27-yr-old man shot dead by 3 bike-borne men in Gurugram
248.article_body: A supervisor of a private company was shot dead by three bike-borne men near Sirhaul village in Gurugram. The deceased, Pankaj Kumar (27), was a native of Samastipur in Bihar and was shot dead when he was walking to his office located in Udyog Vihar Phase 4. An FIR has been registered under section 302 (murder) of the IPC.

249.title: What are the names of the 8 cheetahs brought to India from Namibia?
249.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday released eight cheetahs, three males and five females, brought from Namibia at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, marking the return of once-extinct cheetah back in India. The male cheetahs are named Freddie, Elton and Oban, while the female cheetahs are named Siyaya, Aasha, Tbilisi, Sasha and Savannah. Aasha was named by PM Modi on Saturday.

250.title: She used to talk to me about her kids, like any simple girl: Huma on Madhuri
250.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, recalling working with Madhuri Dixit in the film 'Dedh Ishqiya', said that she made the atmosphere very comfortable. Calling the 55-year-old actress a "sweet human being", Huma said that she used to talk to her about her house and children, "just like any simple girl and like any normal housewife". 'Dedh Ishqiya' was released in 2014.

251.title: Always looked up to him, he’s achieved so much: Nagarjuna on Chiranjeevi
251.article_body: Nagarjuna's upcoming film 'The Ghost' and Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather' are set to clash at the box office on October 5. Talking about the clash, Nagarjuna said he is "worried and anxious" about competing with Chiranjeevi, who he tagged as "a mighty opponent". Nagarjuna added that he "always looked up to" Chiranjeevi. "He has achieved so much," he said about the actor.

252.title: India has gained new confidence under PM Modi: CM Yogi
252.article_body: India has gained new confidence under PM Narendra Modi, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Saturday on the occasion of PM Modi's birthday. "Even the international community today is unable to ignore India when taking decisions. This shows India's strength," CM Yogi added. Furthermore, he said, PM Modi's contribution to India's current growth story started with Kashi.

253.title: Principal, teachers allegedly beat Class 1 girl in UP; FIR filed
253.article_body: An FIR was filed against a principal and two teachers of a school in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj after they allegedly beat a Class 1 girl, police said. According to the complaint, the girl told her parents that the accused had apparently punched, slapped and canned her. The father also claimed that the accused threatened him when he went to school.

254.title: FIR filed against Yediyurappa, his son in alleged ₹12 crore bribe case
254.article_body: A First Information Report (FIR) has been registered by the Karnataka police against BJP leader BS Yediyurappa, his son and state BJP vice-president BY Vijayendra in a corruption case. The FIR was registered based on a complaint, accusing the Bangalore Development Authority officials of demanding ₹12 cr bribe to award a contract to a builder for a government building's construction.

255.title: AAP appoints Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of party's Gujarat unit
255.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has appointed Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha as the co-incharge of the party's unit in Gujarat. He'll be supervising the party's political and election affairs in the state, where Assembly elections are scheduled for this year. "I'll put in my blood, sweat...and toil to meet...expectations of my party. Gujarat wants change...Gujarat wants [Arvind Kejriwal]," Chadha said.

256.title: Ranveer Singh to be part of Rohit Shetty's 'Khatron Ke…' finale: Report
256.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, along with his 'Cirkus' co-stars, will reportedly be a part of the finale episode of Rohit Shetty-hosted show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. While the finale stunt has been shot in Cape Town, the makers are reportedly shooting the winner announcement bit of the episode on Sunday in Mumbai. The episode will also see ex-contestants in attendance.

257.title: Govt to give Pune ₹50 cr every year for flood management
257.article_body: Under its Urban Flood Risk Management project, the central government has decided to include Pune among seven cities. The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has decided to allocate ₹50 crore every year, for the next five years, to Pune. This project helps urban areas that face floods which affects their civic life and essential services.

258.title: Don't delay, police will freeze accounts: B'luru Police on cyber crime
258.article_body: Bengaluru Joint Commissioner of Police Raman Gupta urged the public to not delay reporting cyber crimes. "Immediately after receiving the complaint, the police will freeze the bank accounts of the accused and trace him/her. So sooner the crime is reported, the higher the probability of getting the money back," he added.

259.title: 6.8-magnitude earthquake causes entire train to shake in Taiwan, video surfaces
259.article_body: A 6.8-magnitude earthquake hit Taiwan on Sunday, causing a convenience store to collapse and leading to train carriages being derailed. A video of a train trembling due to the earthquake also surfaced on social media. This was the second earthquake in less than 24 hours in Taiwan after a 6.4-magnitude tremor hit the Taiwanese city of Taitung on Saturday.

260.title: He's an X-factor in Australia's T20 WC squad: Cummins on Singapore-born David
260.article_body: Australia pacer Pat Cummins said Singapore-born batter Tim David is an "X-factor" for the defending champions' T20 World Cup squad. David has played 14 T20Is for Singapore and has been named in Australia's squad for upcoming T20I series against India. "It's great to see...David get his chance," he added. David is yet to make his debut for Australia.

261.title: BJP leaders flummoxed by response to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra’: Chidambaram
261.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said BJP leaders are flummoxed by the response to the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and are resorting to old tools of misinformation, lies and abuse. Earlier today, Congress tweeted, "As we keep walking in the...yatra, we experience an India yet unseen. Every person we've come across carries exuberating courage and...will to fight for India."

262.title: Mahindra Susten sells 30% stake to Canadian fund for ₹2,371 crore
262.article_body: Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan (OTPP) will acquire 30% stake in the Mahindra Group's renewable energy arm Mahindra Susten Pvt Ltd (MSPL) for ₹2,371 crore, a regulatory filing said. The Mahindra Group and the Canadian fund have said that they will invest around ₹4,550 crore in MSPL, the filing showed. The transaction involves setting up an Infrastructure Investment Trust.

263.title: Vedanta-Foxconn plant site in Guj to be finalised in 2 weeks: Official
263.article_body: Vedanta and Foxconn are likely to finalise the site for the semiconductor plant in Gujarat in the next two weeks, state's Science and Technology Department Secretary Vijay Nehra said. Nehra added that various sites in Gujarat are being examined on the basis of technical aspects, commercial viability and connectivity. The production in the semiconductor unit will begin in two years.

264.title: 2 small planes collide midair in US, 3 people killed; pics of planes' debris surface
264.article_body: Two small airplanes collided in midair near Denver in US on Saturday, killing three people. Two people were found dead in one wreckage, and one person in the other, an official said. It was not known what might have caused the crash between the four-seater Cessna 172 and the Sonex Xenos, a light, aluminium aircraft that can seat two.

265.title: Hrithik dances to 'Vikram...' song 'Alcoholia' with fans, video surfaces
265.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan danced with his fans at the 'Alcoholia' song launch event in Mumbai, a video of which has also surfaced online. The actor also taught a few steps to his fans. The song, sung by Vishal-Sheykhar, Snigdhajit Bhowmik and Ananya Chakraborty, is a part of Hrithik's upcoming film 'Vikram Vedha', which is slated to release on September 30.

266.title: 6.8 magnitude earthquake hits Taiwan; train carriages derailed
266.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.8 struck Taiwan's southeastern part on Sunday, the self-governing island's weather bureau said. Two people were reported trapped under the rubble of a collapsed building in Hualien county. The earthquake also caused three railway carriages to get derailed. However, the roughly 20 passengers aboard were evacuated without any injuries, Taiwan's railway authorities said.

267.title: Doctors remove 55 batteries from 66-yr-old woman's stomach & gut in Ireland
267.article_body: Surgeons at an Ireland hospital removed 55 batteries from a 66-year-old woman's stomach and gut after she swallowed them in an apparent act of deliberate self-harm. The woman passed five batteries out of her body naturally, while 46 were removed by surgeons from her abdominal cavity. The remaining four batteries were "milked" into the rectum and removed through the anus.

268.title: 411 trees to be chopped for Bengaluru’s Airport metro line
268.article_body: Karnataka High Court has allowed Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) to cut down 411 trees along KR Puram-Kempegowda International Airport Line's middle section. A total of 4,110 saplings will be planted in Aero Space Park to compensate for this. A BMRCL official said they were waiting for the permission for over a month.

269.title: More fatal accidents at night, West Delhi more prone to fatal crashes: Report
269.article_body: Delhi Road Crash Report 2021 said that road accidents during the day are more than those during night in Delhi but night crashes result in more deaths. The report said that out of the 2,673 daytime crashes, 561 resulted in fatalities while of the 2,047 nighttime crashes, 645 ended in fatalities. West District is the most crash-prone region, report added.

270.title: Thane residents clean creeks to mark Int'l Coastal Cleanup Day
270.article_body: Residents from Thane along with a few environmental activists on Saturday conducted a drive to clean all the creek areas in the district to mark International Coastal Cleanup Day. The Thane Municipal Corporation and the District Collector also joined the drive. "We collected 1,630 kg of coastal waste (from the creeks) between 7 am and 9 am," a resident said.

271.title: Sextortion racket operating from beauty parlour busted in Ghaziabad
271.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have busted a sextortion racket and arrested three women who operated the racket from a beauty parlour in Vijay Nagar. The woman used to make calls to people registered on an online chat platform, record videos of compromising conversations and sexual acts and subsequently used to extort money from them. Police have recovered ₹13 lakh during the investigation.

272.title: Man gets struck by lightning while playing PlayStation in living room in UK, shares pics
272.article_body: A UK man named Aidan Rowan got struck by lightning while playing PlayStation inside his living room. "There was...very loud crack of thunder and I...felt...very heavy sensation all over and then...searing heat in my right arm where there are now burns," he said. He stated doctors theorised that lightning "bounced off water and through the window" to strike him.

273.title: DMart's Noronha, one of India's richest CEOs, buys ₹70 crore home in Mumbai: Report
273.article_body: Retail chain DMart's CEO Ignatius Navil Noronha has purchased a home in Mumbai's Bandra East area for about ₹70 crore, according to registration documents on Zapkey. Noronha, who is one of the richest CEOs in India, bought two apartments in the under-construction project Rustomjee Seasons. The apartments have a total carpet area of 9,552 square feet and 10 car parkings.

274.title: PM is pathological liar, 'Project Cheetah' initiated in 2009: Jairam
274.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted a letter which, he said, initiated ‘Project Cheetah’ in 2009. "Our PM is a pathological liar," Ramesh tweeted. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi said for decades no effort was made to rehabilitate cheetahs. In the letter, Ramesh had asked Dr MK Ranjitsinh of Wildlife Trust of India to prepare a "detailed roadmap for reintroduction of the cheetah".

275.title: Rohit Sharma's 'khichdi' response on being asked about India openers goes viral
275.article_body: During the press conference ahead of India-Australia series, captain Rohit Sharma was asked about who will open for India in T20 World Cup. Rohit stated KL Rahul would open alongside him, with Virat Kohli being the third opening option. "Let me clarify...We're very clear with our thought process...Hamare andar kya khichdi pak rahi hai wo hume pata hai," he added.

276.title: Govt to sell B'luru's Jakkur Aerodrome's land to private parties: Activist
276.article_body: Human Rights Protection and Corruption Eradication Forum State President Raghavendra SR has filed a complaint regarding a land deal worth ₹1,500 crore regarding Bengaluru's Jakkur Aerodrome. He alleged Karnataka government of planning to give over 75 acres of Aerodrome's land to "private parties with vested interests". This will make safe aircraft landings at Aerodrome "impossible", he said.

277.title: CBI, forensic officials inspect nightclub where Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged
277.article_body: The CBI team, along with forensic officials, reached the Curlies nightclub at Anjuna beach to investigate the death of actor Sonali Phogat. Curlies was the club where the actor was allegedly drugged by two of her male companions. The CBI team took over the probe from Goa police on September 15 and registered an FIR in the case.

278.title: 2 senior citizens killed in elephant attacks in Chhattisgarh
278.article_body: Two senior citizens were killed in separate incidents of elephant attacks in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Sunday. The first incident took place near Abhaypur village, where the deceased, Manbodh God (70), was having dinner before an elephant trampled him to death, officials said. Meanwhile, the second deceased, Raimati God (70), was attacked by the same herd in Janardanpur village.

279.title: Russia may step up attack on civilian infrastructure in Ukraine: UK
279.article_body: UK has said that Russia widened its strikes on civilian infrastructure in Ukraine in the past week and is likely to expand its target range further. Five civilians were killed in Russian strikes in Donetsk region. Several dozen high-rise and private buildings, gas pipelines and power lines have also been damaged in Nikopol due to Russian strikes, officials said.

280.title: Inspired by old Hollywood films: Stylist on Zendaya's Emmy outfit
280.article_body: Zendaya's stylist Law Roach said the actress' Emmy Awards outfit was inspired by "old Hollywood movies" and "Valentino's fall 1987 collection". He said the outfit was put together in a week. "This look could have been perceived as costumey, but it's the way that she carries herself on the carpet, where it never ends up looking that way," he added.

281.title: 'Ocean's Eleven' actor Henry Silva passes away at 95
281.article_body: Veteran American actor Henry Silva, who starred in films like 'Ocean's Eleven' and 'The Manchurian Candidate', passed away on Wednesday aged 95. He died of natural causes in California, his son Scott told Variety. Henry, who made his acting debut in the 1950s, appeared in over 100 projects. He also voiced Bane in the animated series 'The New Batman Adventures'.

282.title: Woman found murdered in Delhi, missing flatmate prime suspect
282.article_body: A 22-year-old woman was found murdered with a sharp injury on her neck at her rented flat in Delhi's Maujpur on Saturday. DCP (Northeast Delhi) Sanjay Kumar Sain said that the woman was living with a man at the flat, adding that he is the prime suspect in the case. He is at large and police are looking for him.

283.title: It felt surreal: Riddhima on walking the ramp at London Fashion Week
283.article_body: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni, daughter of Neetu Kapoor and late Rishi Kapoor, recently walked the ramp at London Fashion Week for the UK-based fashion brand Helen Anthony. Talking about the experience, Riddhima said it "felt surreal" and "amazing". "I can't believe it is all over. It was quite an experience, and it was just amazing with a capital A," she said.

284.title: Uttar Pradesh govt transfers 14 IAS officers, 10 districts get new DMs
284.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has reshuffled 14 IAS officers, including District Magistrates of 10 districts. New DMs have been appointed in Hardoi, Barabanki, Mirzapur, Ghazipur, Agra, Chandauli, Mathura, Pilibhit, Bhadohi and Sant Kabir Nagar. Meanwhile, Relief Commissioner and Secretary Revenue Department Ranveer Prasad has also been assigned the responsibility of Housing Commissioner.

285.title: Sushant's sister says she saw the late actor in dreams, shares his picture
285.article_body: While sharing his picture on Twitter, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Priyanka Singh said that she saw her late brother in her dreams. "What life has mercilessly denied me...I seemed to steal in the peace of my sleep...a relaxed setting in your playful yet intense company, discussing...your favourite perfume and the fragrance lingers on all around me," she wrote.

286.title: Feels a bit different: Cameron Diaz on returning to acting after hiatus
286.article_body: Hollywood actress Cameron Diaz said making a comeback to acting after a long hiatus felt "a little bit different". Diaz will star with Jamie Foxx in her upcoming film 'Back in Action'. The two had previously shared the screen space in Diaz's last on-screen appearance, 'Annie' (2014). "He's so great, so professional and talented," Diaz said about Foxx.

287.title: Hundreds of court cases will be settled once UCC introduced in U’khand: CM
287.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the Uniform Civil Code will settle hundreds of cases pending in various courts of the state once it comes into force. "We want equal rights and equal law(s), irrespective of different faith and ethnicity for those living in the Himalayan state having international border with China and Nepal," News18 quoted Dhami as saying.

288.title: Another huge problem: LinkedIn Co-founder on Musk's plan to buy Twitter
288.article_body: LinkedIn Co-founder Reid Hoffman revealed that he was worried when he first learned about his friend Tesla CEO Elon Musk's plan to buy Twitter. In a podcast interview, Hoffman said, "I read the tweet and I think I had the reaction of most people, it was like, 'Oh my God, another huge problem'. He's already dealing with a large number."

289.title: My father had always been a box office guy: Ranbir on Rishi Kapoor
289.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor called his late father Rishi Kapoor "a box office guy", who was "very respectful of the numbers and how the film fared at the ticket window". Ranbir said Rishi "would have been very happy" to see how 'Brahmastra' was performing at the box office. He added that Rishi would've also said, "Let's see how the second-weekend fares".

290.title: Was numb, couldn't function: Ayesha Jhulka on Divya Bharti's death
290.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka opened up about her friendship with late actress Divya Bharti and shared that she was one of the first few to learn about her death. "I was numbed. I just couldn't function," Ayesha shared. The actress remembered that the dubbing of her film 'Rang' was cancelled thrice because she was "just crying" and "wasn't able to dub".

291.title: Poland opens new canal; PM says, it'll 'break dependence on Russia'
291.article_body: Poland on Saturday opened a new sea waterway, which the country's leaders say will stop its need to take permission from Russia for ships to travel from Baltic Sea to the ports of Vistula Lagoon. The country's PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that with the opening of this shipping canal, Poland will "break the last bonds of [its] dependence on Russia".

292.title: Death toll from Tajikistan border conflict rose to 36: Kyrgyzstan
292.article_body: Kyrgyzstan said on Sunday that its death toll from the border conflict with Tajikistan has risen to 36, while 129 people have been injured. This comes after both the countries accused each other of deploying heavy weaponry at the border after a clash broke out. Kyrgyzstan added that it had evacuated 1.37 lakh people from the area amid the conflict.

293.title: Govt shares pic of cheetah lying on its back a day after arriving in India
293.article_body: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has shared a picture of one of the cheetahs that were released in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park by PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. "Cheetah's after welcome party at Kuno National Park," the ministry wrote with the picture showing the cheetah lying on its back.

294.title: India lose their Davis Cup 2022 World Group I tie against Norway 1-3
294.article_body: Indian tennis team lost their Davis Cup 2022 World Group I tie against hosts Norway 1-3 in Lillehammer on Saturday. India were trailing 0-2 after first day. Doubles pair of Saketh Myneni-Yuki Bhambri was defeated by Casper Ruud-Viktor Durasovic 6-3, 3-6, 6-3 in the first match of the second day. Sumit Nagal won his match to make the tie 1-3.

295.title: BJP MP challenges Bihar CM to contest 2024 Lok Sabha polls from UP
295.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi challenged Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to contest Lok Sabha elections from any constituency in UP. "Nitish ji should try to contest the Lok Sabha election from Phulpur...or from anywhere in UP. If he fails to save the deposit, then he shall return to Bihar as a candidate who lost his deposit," Sushil said.

296.title: Man poses as Army officer to cheat aspirants in Pune; arrested
296.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly posing as an Army officer on social media and cheating aspiring candidates by promising them defence job offers in Pune. Police have seized an Army uniform and some fake documents identifying him as an Army officer. The accused visited campuses of some defence establishments in the past.

297.title: 27 killed, 20 injured as bus crashes in China's Guizhou province
297.article_body: A bus crashed in southwest China's mountainous Guizhou province, killing 27 people and injuring 20, local police said. The bus carrying 47 people reportedly rolled over on a highway. The incident took place in the early hours of Sunday morning in Qiannan prefecture located in a remote and mountainous part of Guizhou province which is home to several ethnic minorities.

298.title: Be ready to go to jail: Delhi CM Kejriwal at AAP national convention
298.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that BJP-led central government will put everyone in jail, adding, "Be prepared to go to jail for 3-4 months." He was speaking at AAP's national convention in Delhi attended by the party's MLAs and MPs among others from across the country. "BJP-led central government...spent ₹7,000-8,000 crore on poaching of MLAs," Kejriwal said.

299.title: HC orders BBMP to halt encroachment demolition at Bagmane Tech Park
299.article_body: Karnataka HC has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to halt its demolition drive at Bagmane Tech Park for alleged encroachment of stormwater drains. The Park's petition had alleged that BBMP officials were attempting to tear down compound walls without conducting a survey or giving prior notice. The petitioners said they'd themselves demolish compound walls if they're found guilty.

300.title: Automobile firm defrauded of over ₹1 crore in Gurugram
300.article_body: A private automobile company was allegedly duped of over ₹1 crore by a fraudster in Gurugram. The suspect sent texts to the company's chief financial officer, Vivek Gupta, by posing as the firm's VC and asked him to transfer funds to seven different bank accounts. Gupta subsequently discovered that the sender was not the VC and someone else impersonated him.

301.title: Chahatt Khanna breaks silence on 'links' with conman Sukesh, says 'It makes no sense'
301.article_body: After reports claimed she met conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar in Tihar jail, actress Chahatt Khanna called it a "twisted" portrayal of reality. She said, "There is a lot I want to say, but then I feel why should I have to clarify myself. It makes no sense right now." She added, "My family and I are just laughing reading the reports."

302.title: Cong pres or not, Rahul will have pre-eminent place in party: Chidambaram
302.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram has stated that Rahul Gandhi will always have a "pre-eminent place" in the party irrespective of whether he is president or not. He further said that Rahul is the "acknowledged leader" of the rank and file of the party. Rahul has declined the party president post so far but may change his mind, Chidambaram added.

303.title: Man on roller skates almost collides with King Charles' car, video surfaces
303.article_body: A video of a man on roller skates almost colliding with King Charles’ car surfaced online. The incident took place when King Charles was on his way to Westminster Hall to perform a vigil at Queen Elizabeth's coffin on Friday. While the man was handcuffed at the scene, police let him leave after they found he had no malicious intent.

304.title: Ukrainians search for dead relatives at grave site in town of Izium
304.article_body: Residents of the Ukrainian town of Izium searched for dead relatives as emergency workers continued to dig out bodies after Russian forces were driven out of the region. The causes of death have not been ascertained, however, residents said some died in an airstrike. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said investigators have found evidence of torture against people buried in Izium.

305.title: Mohammad Shami ruled out of T20I series against Australia due to COVID-19
305.article_body: Fast bowler Mohammad Shami will not be able to take part in the upcoming three-day T20I series against Australia after testing positive for COVID-19, the BCCI said. Fast bowler Umesh Yadav, who last played a T20I in 2019, has been named Shami's replacement. The T20I series between India and Australia will begin on Tuesday.

306.title: I still give Kim advice, it's going to go to the kids: Kanye
306.article_body: Rapper Kanye West in an interview has stated that he still gives his ex-wife Kim Kardashian advice on things that can help, adding, "Because that's going to go to the kids." He further said, "She's still got to, basically 80% of the time, raise those children." The two have four children together and Kim filed for separation in February 2021.

307.title: Congress leader held for sexually assaulting 20-yr-old beautician at his salon in K'taka
307.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader, Manoj Karjagi, was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 20-year-old beautician at his salon in the Dharwad district. The woman reportedly alleged that Karjagi tried to hug and kiss her after coming to the salon on Saturday. She screamed after the incident, following which some people came to help her, according to reports.

308.title: Alia can get daunting, she's boisterous and bullies you: Ranbir
308.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has called his wife actress Alia Bhatt daunting in an interview, adding that she is "a bit boisterous" and "can bully you". He further said that he has the best manager in the world and that is Alia. "She's got the best management skills in the world...She just makes it happen and...makes my life easy," Ranbir added.

309.title: 60-year-old man climbs 48-storey skyscraper in Paris with no rope, pics surface
309.article_body: Climber Alain Robert, also known as "French Spiderman", scaled a 48-storey skyscraper in Paris without using ropes or harness to mark his 60th birthday. "I want to send people the message that being 60 is nothing. You can still do...fabulous things," he said. Robert began climbing in 1975 and has climbed the 613-foot-tall TotalEnergies tower in Paris on numerous occasions.

310.title: Kerala man arrested after severing separated wife's hands with machete
310.article_body: Kerala Police has arrested a man for allegedly severing both hands of his wife with a machete. The accused also chopped off the victim's hair and inflicted injuries on her head. The two lived together for only one year and had been living separately for the past five years. Their divorce case has been proceeding in a family court.

311.title: SpaceX to launch 54 Starlink satellites after 5 delays on Sept 18
311.article_body: SpaceX has announced that it will be attempting to launch 54 Starlink satellites on September 18. The launch has already witnessed five consecutive delays due to unfavourable weather. The first launch was attempted on September 13. The firm has launched 41 missions so far this year and plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

312.title: US Prez Biden to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II lying in state
312.article_body: US President Joe Biden is likely to pay tribute at the coffin of Queen Elizabeth II in London on Sunday. Biden will then join King Charles and other world leaders for a reception ahead of the grand state funeral scheduled for Monday. Hundreds of thousands of people have been queueing up to pay respects to the Queen lying in state.

313.title: Depriving public of benefits has become virtue for Cong: Union Minister
313.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said that not fulfilling people's expectations and depriving the public of benefits has become a virtue for Congress. While speaking at an event in Shimla's Rampur, Irani said, "They even did not complete the historic Atal Tunnel. This only highlights their inabilities. It was the BJP that completed the Atal Tunnel."

314.title: What is National Logistics Policy, launched by PM to reduce logistics cost?
314.article_body: PM Narendra Modi unveiled the National Logistics Policy, which aims to bring down the high cost of logistics in the country. The policy will ensure quick last-mile delivery, end transport-related challenges, save time and money of manufacturers, and prevent wastage of agro-products. Further, the Unified Logistics Interface Platform will bring all transportation services to a single-window portal.

315.title: BMC to construct two bridges in Mumbai's Chembur
315.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to construct two bridges in Mumbai's Chembur area near the Anik Panjrapol connector road. Both the bridges will be built at a cost of around ₹58 crore. According to the proposal, the south-bound bridge would be 50 metres long while the north-bound bridge would be 100 metres.

316.title: Amit Shah distributes equipment to specially-abled people in Hyd
316.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah distributed various equipment to specially-abled people and cleaning machines to government schools and community hostels in Hyderabad to mark PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday. "PM Modi urges that every person should involve themselves in work of service...so that crores of poor, downtrodden, backward and needy persons...get help," he said.

317.title: Women remove hijabs to protest against 22-yr-old woman's death in Iran
317.article_body: Several women in Iran took off their hijabs to mark their protest against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini following her detention by 'morality police' in Iran. A video of the protest has surfaced online, showing the women cheering and raising slogans after removing their hijabs. A huge crowd gathered at a cemetery, chanting "death to dictator" slogan.

318.title: At least 126 cattle dead due to lumpy skin disease in Maharashtra
318.article_body: The Maharashtra animal husbandry department confirmed that at least 126 cattle have died after being infected by the lumpy virus. "Lumpy skin disease has been rapidly spreading all throughout the Maharashtra state. It is a cutaneous viral disease of the bovines. This disease is not transmitted to human beings either from animals or through cow milk," said the department.

319.title: All rumours of objectionable videos of girls are false: Chandigarh University
319.article_body: Chandigarh University has issued a statement after protests over alleged leaked videos of girl students, saying, "All the rumours of objectionable videos shot of other girl students are totally false and baseless." It added, "No videos were found of any student which are objectionable except a personal video shot by a girl which was shared by her with her boyfriend."

320.title: High-level inquiry ordered, will take strict action: Mann on Chandigarh University videos
320.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has ordered a high-level inquiry in the Chandigarh University videos case. Taking to Twitter, Mann said, "Sad to hear about an incident at Chandigarh University. Our daughters are our pride. Have ordered a high-level inquiry into the incident." "[We] will take strict action...I appeal to all of you to avoid rumours," he added.

321.title: Elon Musk responds after Russia warns against military use of civilian satellites
321.article_body: After a Russian official said civilian satellites “may become a legitimate target for retaliation” if used for military purposes, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Starlink is meant for peaceful use only." While the official didn't mention SpaceX, he said this "extremely dangerous trend" has become apparent in Ukraine. Notably, SpaceX provided Starlink terminals to Ukraine after Russian invasion.

322.title: Mentality of North India, Parliament not conducive for women's quota: Pawar
322.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said the "mentality" of North India and the Parliament seems not conducive yet to giving reservation to women in Legislative Assemblies and Lok Sabha. "When I was CM of Maharashtra, reservation for women in local bodies like ZP and Panchayat Samiti was introduced. It was opposed initially but later people accepted it," he added.

323.title: At least I got it, many gifted actors did not: Gajraj on opportunity after 50
323.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao said he feels no negativity that he got an opportunity like 'Bahaai Ho' after turning 50. "At least I got it. There are so many gifted actors who didn't," he said, adding, "There are countless actors who could have played part of Jitendra Kaushik in 'Badhaai Ho' very well...but I was very fortunate...that Amit Sharma chose me."

324.title: Won't recognise illegally appointed Varghese as St Stephen's principal: DU
324.article_body: The University of Delhi has written to the governing body of St Stephen's college, stating that it will not recognise Professor John Varghese as the college's principal since his five-year term ended. The University has asked the college to follow UGC regulations. "Not following the said provisions amounts to an illegal and non-statutory continuation of...Varghese as Principal," the letter stated.

325.title: Hundreds join drive to clean Philippines' Manila Bay; pics surface
325.article_body: Hundreds of volunteers joined a drive to clean the polluted Manila Bay in the Philippines to mark International Coastal Cleanup Day on Saturday. Pictures of the drive have surfaced online. "This initiative will help make our coastal area in Manila Bay better so that our tourists and visitors will see the beauty of the bay," a college student told Reuters.

326.title: Crude bomb explodes on school roof in West Bengal, students evacuated
326.article_body: A crude bomb exploded on the roof of a three-storied boys' school building in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district on Saturday when classes were in progress. There was no casualty as students and teachers were in rooms on the first two floors of the building, police said. Students were evacuated while teachers found bomb splinters close to the roof.

327.title: Chin up, everything will change soon: Richa Chadha on boycott trend
327.article_body: Commenting on the boycott trend against Bollywood, Richa Chadha said the film industry needs to reimagine and transform, which she believes will happen soon. "Chin up, head up and may the force be with us all," she wrote on Instagram. Apologising to fans for being away from social media, Richa said she's been busy with shoots and some personal preparations.

328.title: Technology is not just for elite: SC judge on paperless courts
328.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said digitisation of courts will assist in crisis-proofing our justice delivery system. Speaking at inauguration of ‘Paperless District Courts in Odisha’ project, he said, "Technology is not just for the elite, it is for all those whom the delivery of justice is intended. Paperless courts will also save precious time for lawyers."

329.title: Japan issues landslide warning as Typhoon Nanmadol approaches Kyushu
329.article_body: Typhoon Nanmadol moved towards Japan's southernmost main island Kyushu on Sunday. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) has warned of high waves "like never experienced before" along with landslides and overflowing rivers. The US Navy's Joint Typhoon Warning Center has classified the 14th typhoon of the season as a super typhoon, the JMA said. Railway operators cancelled trains in the region.

330.title: Vendor urinates on vegetables before selling them in UP, arrested after video goes viral
330.article_body: A vegetable vendor identified as Sharif Khan was arrested after a video showing him urinating on vegetables on his cart before going to sell them in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly went viral on social media. The man was reportedly beaten up by locals before being arrested. Bareilly Police have stated that an FIR has been registered at Prem Nagar Police Station.

331.title: Only 1 video of accused girl found: Police on 'leaked videos of 60 Chandigarh University girls'
331.article_body: After protests erupted in Chandigarh University over reported leak of videos of around 60 girls taking baths, Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said, "So far in our investigation, we've found only one video of the accused herself." He added there is no other video of anyone and the accused girl has also not claimed of recording any video of other girls.

332.title: Hebbal Durga Puja celebrations to begin on October 1 in Bengaluru
332.article_body: The iconic Hebbal Durga Puja celebrations are going to begin on October 1 this year in Bengaluru. This year's theme is titled "Phire Dekho Kolkata" and it will capture the unforgettable images of Kolkata's Durga Puja celebrations over the years. The organisers said that this time the decorations are deeply inspired by the iconic Jorasanko Thakurbari.

333.title: Couple hacked Holiday Inn-owner IHG's tech systems via a weak password 'for fun'
333.article_body: A couple from Vietnam, who allegedly hacked the technical systems of Holiday Inn owner InterContinental Hotels Group, said they did it "for fun". The couple said that they first tried a ransomware attack and then deleted large amounts of data after they were foiled. While they claimed that they accessed IHG's databases via a weak password, Qwerty1234, IHG refuted this.

334.title: After ‘Chandni Bar’, people assumed I love dark cinema: Bhandarkar
334.article_body: Director Madhur Bhandarkar said people assumed that he loves to make dark cinema after the release of 'Chandni Bar' (2001), but when he got 'Babli Bouncer', he wanted to make a comedy film. "After the first pandemic hit us so badly, I felt we really need a comedy film that people can watch with their family," Bhandarkar said.

335.title: Delhi CM Kejriwal condemns Chandigarh University video leak incident
335.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has condemned the Chandigarh University video leak incident calling it very serious and shameful. He also assured the students that all culprits will get the harshest punishment. "We are with you. All must act with patience," Kejriwal tweeted. Students of the university staged a massive protest all night after the incident came to light.

336.title: Ashok Gehlot passes resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress President
336.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential election, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress chief again. "Whatever the National President (Sonia Gandhi) decides would be accepted, including the appointment of state chiefs," said Rajasthan minister PS Khachariyawas. The polls for the crucial post will be held on October 17.

337.title: Levi's announces new season of collaboration with Deepika Padukone
337.article_body: Levi's has launched the third season of its collaboration with Deepika Padukone. Inspired by her ease in making relaxed, oversized pieces look effortlessly stylish, the collection is a creative re-imagination of what is authentically Levi’s®, it said, adding that it fused exaggerated proportions of the 90s with a modern-day streetwear vibe through its range of fits, co-ord sets & more.

338.title: NIA conducts raids at several places in Andhra Pradesh & Telangana in PFI case
338.article_body: The National Investigation Agency, on Sunday, conducted raids at several locations in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in connection with the PFI case. Raids were conducted in Nellore, Kurnool, Kadapa and Guntur of Andhra Pradesh and in Nizamabad and Jagtial in Telangana. The probe agency also searched the residence of Shadulla who is the main accused in the case.

339.title: Grew up listening to stories on anti-Sikh riots: Diljit Dosanjh
339.article_body: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh said he "grew up listening" to stories on the anti-Sikh riots. The actor said his film 'Jogi', which revolves around the 1984 massacre, is an amalgamation of all such stories. "The story is real," Diljit said, adding, "People who have seen or heard, they can relate, and the newer generation will know what had happened".

340.title: Taunting person for handicap most inhumane cruelty: Punjab & Haryana HC
340.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has observed taunting a person for their handicap constitutes the most inhumane kind of cruelty to any disabled person. The court made this observation while granting divorce to a polio-afflicted man. His plea for divorce on the grounds of cruelty and desertion was dismissed by a trial court which he had challenged in HC.

341.title: India reports 5,664 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate now at 1.96%
341.article_body: India reported 5,664 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,747 fresh COVID-19 cases. Meanwhile, 4,555 recoveries were recorded across India in the last 24 hours. The active cases in the country now stand at 47,922. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.96%.

342.title: William, Harry stand vigil at Queen's coffin along with cousins
342.article_body: Prince William and Prince Harry stood vigil along with Queen Elizabeth II's six other grandchildren at her coffin for 15 minutes on Saturday. A video of the vigil shows both the brothers standing on either side of the coffin, wearing military uniforms. Earlier, King Charles III authorised Prince Harry to wear the uniform after he was banned from doing so.

343.title: Talking about a few subjects: Sunny on teaming up with Rajkumar Santoshi
343.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol said he and director Rajkumar Santoshi are waiting to collaborate on a film and "discover something new". The actor-director duo has previously worked on films like 'Ghayal', 'Ghatak' and 'Damini'. Stating that they often meet each other, Sunny informed, "There are a couple of subjects we are talking about at the moment, so let's hope they materialise."

344.title: Starbucks customers' data accessed in online breach in Singapore
344.article_body: Starbucks Singapore said on Friday that its customer database was breached online in which information of 2,00,000 people was reportedly stolen. In an e-mail to customers seen by AFP, Starbucks Singapore said it had discovered unauthorised access to details like names, gender and phone numbers. The stolen data was put on sale in an online forum, The Straits Times reported.

345.title: Kanpur residents ask UP CM to demolish apartments over inferior quality
345.article_body: Residents of Kanpur's KDA Residency staged a protest on Saturday over the inferior quality of the apartments. They posted banners outside the society urging Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to demolish the apartments. A resident said in an interview, "Apartments weren't made of the quality that was promised to us. Inferior construction material was used. The building has deteriorated."

346.title: Who is Gautam Adani's eldest son Karan, who has been named Chairman of ACC?
346.article_body: Karan Adani, the eldest son of the world's second richest person Gautam Adani, has been appointed as the Chairman of cement producer ACC following its acquisition by Adani Group. The 35-year-old graduated with a bachelor's degree in economics from Purdue University, USA, in 2009. Karan has been overseeing Adani Ports and Special Economic Zones (APSEZ) as its CEO since 2016.

347.title: Dalit student beaten by teacher over complain on faulty computers in UP
347.article_body: A Dalit student was beaten by his teacher and left with a fractured hand after complaining about non-functional computers in a UP school. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Principal Secretary and District Magistrate visited Deendayal Upadhyaya Ashram Paddhati Vidyalaya in Chandauli for inspection. The officials reprimanded the teacher who felt humiliated and vented his anger on the student.

348.title: Pelosi-led US delegation arrives in Armenia days after clashes with Azerbaijan
348.article_body: US congressional delegation led by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi arrived in Armenia on Saturday. The trip comes days after clashes broke out between Armenia and Azerbaijan in which more than 200 troops were killed.
