The US Embassy said the trip will include meeting with Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. "The trip is all about human rights," Pelosi said in Berlin.

349.title: Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway where Cyrus Mistry died, claimed over 60 lives this year
349.article_body: The 100-km stretch of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway between Ghodbunder in Thane and Dapchari in Palghar district witnessed 262 accidents this year, claiming at least 62 lives and leaving 192 persons injured, said police officials. The Charoti stretch, where former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident, has seen 26 deaths since the start of this year.

350.title: I am very dependent on Alia Bhatt: Ranbir Kapoor
350.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he is very dependent on his wife and actress Alia Bhatt. "I don't go to the bathroom or eat food without knowing where she is. It is very important for me that Alia stays near me," he said. Alia added that while they are good individually, they are better together.

351.title: Right decision: Ukrainian Prez on Nike leaving Russian market
351.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he spoke to representatives of the sportswear brand Nike and thanked them for the company's decision to leave the Russian market, calling it the "right decision". "If a state chooses the path of terror, it is the duty of every self-respecting company to distance itself from such a state," he added.

352.title: Blake Lively criticises paparazzi waiting outside her house; shares pregnancy pics for them
352.article_body: Hollywood actress Blake Lively, who's expecting her fourth child with actor Ryan Reynolds, has criticised the paparazzi waiting outside her house. "Here are photos of me pregnant in real life so the 11 guys waiting outside my home...will leave me alone. You freak me and my kids out...thank you to the media who have a 'No Kids Policy'," she wrote.

353.title: No deaths or attempt to suicide reported: Police on leaked videos of Chandigarh University girls
353.article_body: After students of Chandigarh University protesting over the reported leak of videos of girl students bathing in the hostel alleged loss of life and injuries, Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said, "No suicide attempt or death has taken place." "One student who was taken in an ambulance was suffering from anxiety and our team is in contact with her," he added.

354.title: Over 1 lakh people donated blood on PM's birthday: Health Minister
354.article_body: Over one lakh volunteers donated blood under the 'Raktdaan Amrit Mahotsav' that was flagged off on the occasion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. Taking to Twitter, the Health Minister wrote, "A new world record was created on the very first day with over 87,000 people voluntarily donating in a single day."

355.title: Manoj Bajpayee meets Lalu Prasad in Patna, Bihar Deputy CM shares pics
355.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday shared pictures of actor Manoj Bajpayee meeting RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in Patna. Tejashwi wrote alongside the pictures in Hindi, "Son of Bihar's soil, a well-known actor of Hindi cinema, Padma Shri @BajpayeeManoj ji reached the residence and got information about the health condition of father Shri @laluprasadrjd ji."

356.title: Australia won't ban Russian tourists: Australian Defence Minister
356.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Richard Marles has said that the country will not ban Russian tourists as part of sanctions imposed on Russia amid the Ukraine war. He said that the sanctions were aimed at the Russian government and "not the Russian people themselves". "Our objective is to empower Ukraine itself...this needs to be resolved on their terms," he further said.

357.title: Vedanta-Foxconn was ready to sign MoU, minister was busy with politics: Aaditya
357.article_body: Vedanta-Foxconn was ready to sign the MoU with the Maharashtra government but the industries minister was busy doing politics, Shiv Sena's Aaditya Thackeray said. "There was a meeting between Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis and Vedanta on August 29 and on September 5, a letter was written to Vedanta asking for time for MoU," The Print quoted Thackeray as saying.

358.title: 109 killed in 341 crashes across 48 Mumbai blackspots between 2019-21: Data
358.article_body: Data released by the Maharashtra Highway Traffic Police said that 109 people were killed in 341 crashes across 48 blackspots in Mumbai between 2019 and 2021. Mumbai is, according to the data, on top of 44 districts studied by the department. Navi Mumbai has come second with 32 blackspots, followed by Nagpur with 23.

359.title: 3 held for illegal possession of deadly weapons: Rachakonda Police
359.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Saturday tweeted that three persons were arrested by the Special Operations Team (LB Nagar) for the alleged illegal possession of deadly weapons and three daggers were seized from them. All three accused, aged between 29 and 36, are residents of Shaheen Nagar. The police said that the trio was using weapons to threaten the public.

360.title: Video shows hundreds of girls protesting at Chandigarh University after bathing videos leak
360.article_body: A video showing hundreds of girls protesting at Chandigarh University and chanting 'we want justice' has surfaced online. The protest broke out at night after videos of around 60 girls taking baths in the hostel were leaked online. Meanwhile, police and the university administration have dismissed claims that multiple students attempted suicide as a result of the incident.

361.title: Techies from Google, Meta paying up to $150,000 on leg-lengthening surgeries: US doctor
361.article_body: A US-based cosmetic surgeon revealed that employees of many technology companies and CEOs are opting for leg-lengthening procedures which cost between $70,000 and $150,000. In an interview, the doctor said that his clients include workers from Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Meta and that most of them are men. The doctor also said that his business boomed during the pandemic.

362.title: Guilty won't be spared: Punjab minister on leaked videos of Chandigarh University girls
362.article_body: After protests erupted in Chandigarh University over leaked videos of 60 girls taking baths in the hostel, Punjab Minister of School Education Harjot Singh Bains said, "No one guilty will be spared." He tweeted, "I humbly request all the students of Chandigarh University to remain calm. It's a very sensitive matter and relates to dignity of our sisters and daughters."

363.title: AAP has become curse for Delhi and country: BJP after Amanatullah's arrest
363.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta criticised the AAP government after MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested in connection with the Waqf Board corruption case and said that the party has become a curse for Delhi and the country. "Our protest against corruption in the Delhi government will continue and we will take the issue to the people," said Gupta.

364.title: Actual cinegoers don't look at reviews: Sunny Deol on negative film reviews
364.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol in an interview has stated that actual cinegoers don't look at negative reviews by critics. "He sees the trailer and wants to go to the cinema hall and come out for that intoxication...and it can be gauged from the trailer," he added. The actor further said that critics are doing their job when writing film reviews.

365.title: Ali Asgar's daughter says she & brother were trolled, called 'dadi ki beti'
365.article_body: Comedian Ali Asgar's daughter has revealed she and her brother were teased by their classmates who called them 'dadi ka beta' and 'dadi ki beti'. "He...[makes] fun of himself to make others laugh. That's not everyone's cup of tea," she added. Ali played Dadi in 'Comedy Nights With Kapil', Nani in 'The Kapil Sharma Show' and Basanti in 'Comedy Circus'.

366.title: Govt warns against 'SOVA' Android malware targeting Indian banking users
366.article_body: The government's CERT-In has issued a warning against 'SOVA' Android Trojan, a new type of malware campaign targeting Indian banking customers through more than 200 mobile apps. The malware hides itself within fake Android apps posing as famous and legitimate ones to deceive users. It captures users' credentials when they log into their netbanking apps and access their bank accounts.

367.title: Man of his calibre saying so gives me credit: Jackie on Anil saying he was insecure
367.article_body: Reacting to actor Anil Kapoor's remark saying he felt insecure of his success, actor Jackie Shroff has stated that a man of the former's calibre saying so gives him a lot of credit. "It is normal to look up to your older brother...What he says is such a beautiful emotional display which not many people say it," the actor added.

368.title: No plans to bring back vehicle towing policy in Bengaluru: State Home Minister
368.article_body: Reacting to the suspension of the vehicle towing policy from no-parking zones in Bengaluru, Home Minister Araga Jnanendra claimed that there are no plans to bring back the policy. He said that the department would hold a detailed discussion and obtain expert advice to implement a public-friendly and smooth vehicle parking system in the city.

369.title: UK PM preparing to scrap sugar tax on soft drinks: Report
369.article_body: British PM Liz Truss is reportedly preparing to scrap the sugar tax on soft drinks to ease the country's cost-of-living crisis. A ban on "buy one, get one free" promotions on unhealthy food, which was delayed by the British government earlier, was now unlikely to proceed. Earlier, Truss had said,"(People) don't want the government telling them what to eat."

370.title: World War II vintage bomb detonated safely along Indo-Myanmar border
370.article_body: Security forces on Saturday safely detonated a World War II vintage bomb in eastern Manipur along the Indo-Myanmar border. The bomb was recovered by locals during digging work in Kamjong district. Security forces along with local police shifted the bomb away from populated area and army bomb unit carried out the disposal of 250 lbs bomb using the 'Violent Technique'.

371.title: China reports 1st imported case of monkeypox in city of Chongqing
371.article_body: Mainland China has reported its first case of monkeypox in the city of Chongqing. An individual who arrived in Chongqing from overseas showed symptoms like skin rash during COVID quarantine period, reports said. All close contacts of the traveller have been isolated and put under medical observation. Monkeypox transmits through close contact with infected people or contaminated materials.

372.title: Need to rethink collegium system of appointment: Union Minister
372.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said there is a need to rethink the collegium system to expedite the process of appointment in higher judiciary as there are concerns about existing process. "System which is in place is causing trouble...everyone knows it…I put my views in front of everyone where judges, law officers...were there," Rijiju added during an event.

373.title: Labourer killed after argument over sharing work in Delhi's Azadpur market
373.article_body: A 31-year-old labourer was shot dead a few days after he had got into an argument with another man over sharing of work in Delhi's Azadpur market. The accused decided to take revenge while he was in an inebriated condition on Friday. Police said that a country-made pistol and two live cartridges were recovered from the possession of the accused.

374.title: I'm not on the run: Terra Co-founder after police say he's not in S'pore
374.article_body: Terraform Labs Co-founder Do Kwon has said he is not "on the run" after police said he was no longer in Singapore. This comes after an arrest warrant was issued against Kwon in South Korea. Kwon added he doesn't have anything to hide and is in "full cooperation" with agencies. Singapore police had said they would assist the Korean police.

375.title: Mumbai local train services to be affected on Central and Trans Harbour lines
375.article_body: The Mumbai local train services will be affected on the Central and the Trans Harbour lines today as the Central Railway for the Mumbai division will operate a mega block to carry out maintenance work on the tracks. There will be a five-hour block between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) and Vidyavihar from 10:48 am to 3:49 pm.

376.title: Leaked videos of 60 Chandigarh University girls taking baths trigger protest; 1 arrested
376.article_body: A massive protest broke out at the Chandigarh University last night after videos of around 60 girls taking baths in the hostel were leaked online. Police arrested a girl student who allegedly made those videos and sent them to a boy in Shimla. A case has been registered against the accused girl under Sections 354c of IPC and IT Act.

377.title: Legal aid work is neglected in country, says CJI Lalit
377.article_body: Legal aid work is neglected in the country, CJI UU Lalit said while adding that young law graduates should devote as much time and energy as possible to provide legal aid services. "I've been associated with legal aid work...I don't mean to complain or show disrespect but legal aid in this country is neglected," he added during a convocation ceremony.

378.title: Ajay shares his & Kajol's similar smoking scenes, says 'She beat me to it'
378.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram to share similar smoking scenes from his and actress Kajol's past movies. In both the scenes, they're both respectively told that smoking isn't allowed in the area, to which both reply, asking if the cigarette is lit. "Arey, Kajol beat me to it," Ajay wrote on Instagram.

379.title: Thane woman jumps from building with 6-year-old daughter, both die
379.article_body: A 28-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide by jumping off the sixth floor of a building with her six-year-old daughter in Thane's Mira Road, police said. Both the deceased's bodies were found by the building's residents around 3.30 pm. No suicide note has been found, police added. A case of accidental death has been filed and a probe is underway.

380.title: 3 try to smuggle ₹93.3 lakh-gold at Hyd airport in separate incidents
380.article_body: Three people were arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in separate incidents and gold worth ₹93.3 lakh was recovered. In one incident, gold in spray form, which was hidden by spraying on undergarments, and in chain form were seized from two accused. The third accused tried to hide the gold in a briefcase.

381.title: World's most-followed TikToker Khaby Lame earns up to ₹6 crore per post
381.article_body: The manager of the world's most-followed creator on TikTok, Khaby Lame, revealed that the latter earns up to $750,000 (around ₹6 crore) per post. The 22-year-old’s manager said that Lame is on his way to earning $10 million this year. Lame joined TikTok in 2020 after losing his job as a factory machine worker due to the pandemic.

382.title: Meta asks staff to share desks, reserve seats before coming to office: Report
382.article_body: Meta has reportedly introduced a new desk sharing policy for its employees under which most of them will not have their own place in the office. Employees will instead be asked to reserve desks before they come to office, The Independent reported. Employees allegedly criticised the new policy and suggested that they would end up coming into the office less.

383.title: President Murmu arrives in London to attend Queen Elizabeth II's funeral, pics surface
383.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu has arrived in London to attend the state funeral of Queen Elizabeth II and offer condolences on behalf of the Indian government. Queen Elizabeth II passed away on September 8 at the age of 96 at the Balmoral Castle in Scotland. Her funeral will take place on September 19 at Westminster Abbey in London.

384.title: Delhi likely to get 35,000 seat, 51-acre stadium costing ₹350 crore in 3 yrs
384.article_body: Delhi is likely to get a 51-acre sports facility in three years. Reports said that the sports arena will have a seating capacity of 35,000 and will be made at a cost of an estimated ₹350 crore. The facility will come up in sector 19B of Dwarka and would include sports facilities like swimming, tennis and table tennis.

385.title: Pak reporter asks why women footballers can't wear leggings instead of shorts, criticised
385.article_body: Objecting to his country's women footballers wearing shorts, a Pakistani journalist, during a press conference, asked, “We belong to...Islamic Republic of Pakistan...I want to ask why are these girls wearing shorts, not leggings?" The team's head coach Adeel Rizki said in sports "one has to be progressive". Several social media users criticised the reporter, saying he has "regressive mindset".

386.title: AAP presents 6-month performance card of Punjab govt
386.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) presented a performance card of its six-month-old government in Punjab on Saturday, as it accused previous state governments of corruption. AAP leader Malvinder Kang said the government had so far given 20,000 jobs and regularised services of around 9,000 contractual employees. He added 300 units of free electricity and farming incentives were also given.

387.title: Jan Shatabdi Express derails in Odisha, no casualty reported
387.article_body: The Howrah-Bhubaneswar Jan Shatabdi Express derailed in Bhadrak, Odisha on Saturday, an official said, adding no casualty was reported. The two front wheels close to the engine derailed after the brakes were applied suddenly as there was a bull in front, he said. “It will take around 30 minutes to an hour to resume the train’s journey," the official said.

388.title: S Jaishankar to visit US from September 18-28, set to address UNGA
388.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will be on an official visit to the US during September 18-28. During the visit, he will lead India's delegation at the 77th Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), called High-Level Week. The week is themed 'A Watershed Moment: Transformative Solutions to Interlocking Challenges'. Jaishankar will address the UNGA on September 24.

389.title: Dharmendra Pradhan adopts TB patients from 4 districts of Odisha
389.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday adopted all TB (tuberculosis) patients from Angul, Deogarh, Dhenkanal and Sambalpur districts of Odisha under the 'Pradhan Mantri TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyaan'. The minister said that he has adopted the patients to help realise PM Narendra Modi's goal of a TB-free India by 2025 as well as to mark the latter's 72nd birthday.

390.title: Thousands of Gujarat govt workers join 'mass casual leave' protest
390.article_body: Thousands of Gujarat government employees, including school teachers, have reportedly joined a 'mass casual leave' protest demanding Old Pension Scheme (OPS) implementation. Union body members said nearly 7,000 employees in Bhavnagar and 8,000 in Kutch did not go to work on Saturday. The state had announced on Friday that those who joined before April 2005 would get the OPS benefit.

391.title: Ricciardo's form isn't great: Haas F1 boss rules out signing driver
391.article_body: Haas F1 boss Guenther Steiner said he feels Daniel Ricciardo's "form isn't great" at the moment, thus putting him out of contention for a 2023 seat with the team. "We don't know what he's up to. Maybe he'll sit out a year," said Steiner. He added that he wants to take the least possible risk when picking his next driver.

392.title: Cheetahs arrived but why haven't jobs?: Rahul Gandhi to PM Modi
392.article_body: Addressing PM Modi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Eight cheetahs have come...Why didn't 16 crore jobs come in eight years?" The Congress had decided to observe September 17, which is PM Modi's birthday, as 'National Unemployment Day'. Rahul, during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', said India was facing its 'worst-ever unemployment because of politics of hate'.

393.title: Prince William sends message of support to Aston Villa while in mourning
393.article_body: Aston Villa manager Steven Gerrard revealed that Prince William sent a message of support to the team while he mourns the death of his grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II. "It was along the lines of - would love to be there. He is consistently in touch," said Gerrard. William, a life-long Villa fan, is preparing for his grandmother's funeral on Monday.

394.title: 3 more people arrested in Mundra Port drugs case
394.article_body: Three more people, including an Afghanistan native, have been arrested in the September 2021 Mundra Port drugs case in which 3,000 kg of heroin was reportedly seized. After the arrests, the NIA claimed the drug network was operated by the Daad brothers from Afghanistan. The agency said the network transported five drug consignments from November 2020 to September 2021.

395.title: Karnataka logs 476 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
395.article_body: Karnataka on Saturday reported 476 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, the state health department said.  Of the fresh cases, as many as 215 were logged in Bengaluru Urban district. The lone fatality was recorded in Shivamogga, PTI reported. Active cases in the state stood at 3,735, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

396.title: Umesh Yadav undergoing rehab at National Cricket Academy: Report
396.article_body: Indian pacer Umesh Yadav is reportedly rehabilitating at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru after suffering a thigh muscle injury while playing for English county side Middlesex last month. "Yadav's injury was sustained whilst playing in Middlesex's last home Royal London Cup match of the season against Gloucestershire at Radlett (on August 21)," the county cricket club said.

397.title: Dinesh Karthik has shown no interest in batting in the top 5: Gautam Gambhir
397.article_body: Former India captain Gautam Gambhir said there is no way both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik can play in the same XI during the T20 World Cup. "If you do that, you will miss out on a sixth bowler...Karthik, unfortunately, has shown no interest in batting in the top-5," said Gambhir. He added that Pant can be a match-winner.

398.title: Germany footballer Reus doubtful for World Cup after injuring ankle
398.article_body: Germany footballer Marco Reus, who missed the FIFA World Cup 2014 and Euro 2016 due to injury, is doubtful for FIFA World Cup 2022 after being stretchered off in first half of Dortmund's match against Schalke. Reus was in tears after bending his right ankle unnaturally while challenging for the ball. The extent of the injury hasn't been announced yet.

399.title: Sreesanth shares pics after India Maharajas' win, says 'Never ever give up on your dreams'
399.article_body: Sreesanth took to Instagram to share pictures after India Maharajas defeated World Giants in a special T20 match to mark India's 75 years of independence. "Just want to say...never ever give up on your dreams...just keep at it and for sure...there are many great hearts in the beautiful world to help you out," he wrote.

400.title: SRK's stunt double recalls working with actor in Brahmastra, calls him 'legend'
400.article_body: Hasit Savani, who was Shah Rukh Khan's stunt double in 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', took to Instagram to share a picture of him posing with the actor on the sets of the film. "A real pleasure to be the stunt double for the legend...for his cameo sequence," he captioned the post. Shah Rukh played scientist Mohan Bhargav in the film.

401.title: Main line linking Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant to power grid restored
401.article_body: One of the four main lines supplying power from Ukraine's electricity grid to the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant has been repaired and restored, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said on Saturday. Even though all the six nuclear reactors of the plant are turned off, power is still needed to cool the fuel in them to avoid a meltdown.

402.title: 7 idols in illegal possession of dealer recovered in TN's Viluppuram
402.article_body: The idol wing CID of Tamil Nadu Police on Saturday said seven bronze idols were recovered from the illegal possession of a dealer in Viluppuram. An investigation is on to trace the temples from where they were allegedly stolen. The accused could not establish the provenance of the idols including those of Ardhanareshwar, Goddess Sivakami, Krishna and Buddha, police claimed.
